Reviews.Title: “Not Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: This is a great venue if you're looking for a hotel to accommodate a small meeting. It's location is great and within immediate proximity of some fine eateries and the Gaslamp District of San Diego. The hotel itself is a converted bank (at least part of it is) and one of the meeting rooms is located in the old vault of the hotel. The staff members are excellent. Just the in-house dining experience is average and is typical of most hotels, regardless if they are full or partial service hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Chillin' in the Gas Lamp”
Reviews.Author: outofmeridian
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a four night stay in a King Suite, right next to everything in the GasLamp quarter. Our smiles started at check-in when I mentioned we were celebrating my wife's birthday. Conor needed no more prompting to find the best room available - even though three of our nights were on "points!" Then, we were treated to a fine bottle of wine delivered to our room - no charge. As others have written, the building has interesting features from its origin as a bank. Right next to the Vault Room is a fine fitness area with plenty of cardio equipment, a multi-function weight system, and free-weights. From this location it was easy to walk to shopping at the Horton Mall, to great restaurants along Fifth Ave, or down Broadway to the harbor and the Coronado Ferry. Each time we entered the hotel to return to our room, all the staff at the front desk welcomed us as friends. Put a smile on my wife's face. (You guys know how much that is worth.) Thanks to Conor and Marriott for giving us a great place from which to experience San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: cincygyrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night over the weekend at this hotel and I wish we could have stayed longer!!! This was one of the best experiences I've ever had in a hotel (including the more expensive ones). First, the hotel is a converted bank bldg...every inch of this hotel is gorgeous and well equipped. Loved the security features, room card only access to the floors via the elevators, upgraded room access (not the outdated swipe machines). Great business center area, free use of computers and printer. Rooms were spacious, clean, smelled good. Even the hallways smelled good. I can tell the staff take pride in their hotel. Every staff member I encountered was nothing but FRIENDLY, GRACIOUS, EXTREMELY HELPFUL, they anticipated eveything. Kudos to the staff!! I will be back and will recommend this hotel to anyone visitng SD.

Reviews.Title: “Banker's Palace Est. Cir. 1928”
Reviews.Author: RebelYell1776
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and comfortable accomodations make this nostalgic hotel among the best in the west. The hotel restaurant and bar was nice, offering salads, soups, and beverages for a steal of a deal. The rooms are cozy with spacious baths and gorgeous views. The lobby and corridors of the hotel are from the bank building's original construction in 1928. Decorative ceiling make this an attraction and great place to stay. The old bank vault is still intact and serves as a meeting room. It's the coolest place and centrally located within the Gas Lamp district!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott San Diego Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Jessica O
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. You are in a perfect location for anything and everything you want to do in San Diego. The room is clean, and perfectly designed. I was staying their for four days, and the plans got rained out. I didn't mind one bit, the hotel was so nice. The service was great, and accommodating to anything and everything our team needed. The breakfast and omelet station is to die for. They have a great bar, and serve any type of Starbucks you would like in the morning down at the bar. The rooms are comfortable. The beds are like sleeping on feathers. Most comfortable beds I have slept in. The showers and bathroom were clean and nice lightening. The workout and pool areas were fabulous. The workout room was state of the art, and the pool had cabanas and service all day long.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional customer service!”
Reviews.Author: glen m
Reviews.Content: The room was nicely appointed; the hotel was very clean; it was a very convenient location (walk-able to shops & restaurants & a quick ride to the airport). All of this, while quite good, paled in comparison to the quality of the staff. They were friendly, outgoing, helpful, courteous - the best I have ever encountered in 25 years of business travel. My girlfriend, who travels internationally for her work, characterized them as the best she has seen ever (in the world). It was clear that the desk staff, bell staff, valet attendants, & even the security guard really liked their job. If Marriott could bottle this magic, I would buy it.

Reviews.Title: “COURTYARD COMFORT”
Reviews.Author: FemmeFrancaise
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott. It was downtown, close to the Gaslamp Quarter. It was beautiful, completely remodeled. FRIENDLY, COURTEOUS. HELPFUL STAFF.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Tmbirch
Reviews.Content: The beautiful building is very inviting. The staff is friendly and very helpful. We had an very nice stay and will recommend this hotel to anyone that is in the area. Their are many great restaurants near the hotel. I cannot say enough about the staff. Everyone acted as if they liked their jobs and were genuinely glad to be there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Hawkeye002
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Courtyard by Marriott San Diego Downtown. The good - a very helpful and friendly staff; good location at the top of the Gas Lamp District and convenient to a lot of restaurants and shopping; nice lobby in a cool old bank building. The not so good - While in good shape, the rooms are somewhat Spartan with no safe, no coffee maker, no refrigerator, no minibar, no ice bucket in the rooms; complimentary wired internet in the rooms but no WiFi (WiFi in the lobby). Of these having no safe in a downtown location in a business hotel was the most disturbing. Also, not having WiFi in the rooms was inconvenient. Also, the workout facility was so so at best. The treadmills were a bit old and the dumb bell set was small and missing weights. I give the hotel 4 stars overall because of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, unique property”
Reviews.Author: Sene4454
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this hotel. I enjoyed the brisk 7 minute walk to and fro from the Convention Center everyday. There are a lot of great restaurants around the hotel. The staff was very polite and helpful. Just one caution, watch your back once you are outside the hotel - it is a rough neighborhood, especially during the late hours. The only thing that would make me stay at one of the other Marriott properties is the very limited amenities to the Platinum elite by Courtyard of Marriott . No upgrades, no breakfast etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great staff, unique building”
Reviews.Author: HiHoHiHoRDU
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed in Courtyard by Marriott much lately, but based on this experience I will more. I agree with other reviewers that the staff was amazing. Friendly, helpful, and accommodating. The hotel is in an old converted bank that has more character than 99% of hotels. The room doors are even the originals and the meeting rooms are converted vaults. The location is convenient to most downtown places, but its a decent walk to the convention center or baseball stadium. We have a trade show in SD in 2013 and I hope to be at the same hotel. Rooms: nice and big, very comfortable beds, flat screen TVs, free wired internet (no WiFi that I noticed, but I was always working at the desk). My room was on the 12th floor and had giant windows with a view of the area. Value was very good for the area. Bathroom: nothing remarkable, but clean and perfectly fine. Service: From the minute I got there, everyone was friendly and did everything they could to meet my requests. I never felt like a distraction or ignored in any way. I felt like a valued customer. Location: about 1 mile from the convention center or Petco Park (Padres), tons of restaurants in walking. I didn't have a car (walked everywhere and loved it), but I think parking is somewhat of a hassle and expensive. Probably not much different than any other downtown hotel, I just very rarely stay in downtown hotels. Only bad comment on the location is that its sort of the dirtier end of the Gaslamp area and you should be prepared to be confronted by many homeless people. Some of the stores and restaurants in the immediate area are a bit on the seedy side (pawn shops, dirty little restaurants). If you walk a few blocks more, it gets better. None of this really bothered me, but it may not be what some people expect. Exercise room: I'd give it 4 stars. Far better than a typical Hampton Inn or Holiday Inn Express closet with some crappy 10 year old treadmill, but I've seen better. The machines were good (maybe 3 treadmills, 1 bike, all with internal TV, weights, etc) but the room was fairly warm even after I asked them to make it cooler. Its also odd that the TVs on the machines only get a few channels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff/Excellent Location-Unbeatable Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Colie85
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel, and we were pleasantly surprised with the level of customer service. My boyfriend and I both work for "Big Banks" where customer service can feel robotic and insincere. We were very appreciative to be greeted by our names, and treated like royalty. The facilities were very clean, and well kept. You cannot beat the location!! Be sure to ask the concierge for some dinner/drink suggestions- they were all very knowledgeable!! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Bill n
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the gas lamp neighborhood (On the eastern edge) and is a great value. It is on the edge, so not unusual to run into a few street people but that is San Diego. Climate is so great it can accomodate all types of people year round. The rooms was nice and the rates are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with my 21 yr old daughter last week. We really enjoyed the beautiful building- a former bank and historical landmark that has been restored with many of the original features preserved. It is quite a unique place to stay. We were given a tour of the hotel by the very knowledgeable and entertaining Nicolas McQueen. The tour included the vault and cupola, as well as some ghost stories. Service in the hotel was excellent. We requested a small refrigerator and it was delivered within 10 minutes. The staff were very helpful with giving directions, getting taxis etc. Location is excellent- 15 min walk to the convention center and 5 min to restaurants in the Gaslamp Quarter. The hotel is on the border between the Gaslamp Quarter and a somewhat seedy area of the city, but this was not a problem. Fitness center was good and never crowded. We wished there had been wireless internet in the rooms. There was a free cable connection, but we had to share it.

Reviews.Title: “My best stay at a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Daniel E
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few hotels that justify a visit on its own. It is a former bank and a historical landmark that has been converted into a hotel in a very considerable fashion keeping the spirit of the original bank. I recommend that you go down in the basement and see the vaults, which are now meeting rooms and the gym. The breakfast was good and the hotel staff were exceptional. The location was perfect for us as it was easy to get tram or a short walk to all the main attractions. It was removed enough from the Gas Lamp in order for the nights to be quiet. We stayed for more than a week and required all sorts of extra services and advice - all promptly and accurately answered by the staff. SImply put, my best hotel experience in the USA, If anything, I would have opted for a room higher up in the building as there was some noise from the air conditioning units outside as well as some traffic.

Reviews.Title: “inspired to do my first hotel review - ever”
Reviews.Author: D J
Reviews.Content: Wow. Fantastic experience by EVERY single person that interacted with me from Courtyard Marriott - valet, front desk, bell hop, etc. Every single person i encountered made me feel welcome. Fortunately, I had the opportunity to run into members of the hotel management for the location and shared my opinion. I often stay in nice hotels because of conferences: 4 Seasons, Ritz Carlton, Montage, St Regis... While the properties are different, I can say that the employees here were on par with the aforementioned locations. I do not hesitate recommneding this hotel and location. The building is quite interesting because it is an historic building - previously it was a bank. They kept a lot of the architecture and it is beautiful. The rooms are well appointed and the hallways are memorable because of the architecture. The sub basement where the workout facility is was previously the location for the bank's vault and safe deposit boxes. The different areas were turned into meeting rooms - awesome! The location was originally a prime factor in choosing this location and it did not disappoint. Steps from the main drag of the Gaslamp District was immensely convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca A
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the final two weeks of a full 10 weeks of business travel and the staff here really kept my spirits up! Everyone I encountered while staying here was kind, helpful and sincere. I especially want to thank Alexis for making me feel like I was the only guest in the hotel. Also, thanks so much to Nick and Danny for going above and beyond helping me with several trips to Fedex - they were incredibly kind and accommodating. Also, thanks to Ryan for brightening tough work days with his smile and stories. Staying here made it impossible to be in a bad mood. I will be telling everyone to stay at Courtyard Downtown San Diego when they travel. Thanks for the superior service!

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: countryguylawrence
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February as a quick overnight until early morning flight out. It had great character and the staff was very friendly and helpful. They arranged a taxi and were very helpful with directions and just general info. Our only complaint was that our room had a definite smoke smell. The room was very nice, just the taint of old smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall stay”
Reviews.Author: DEK2000
Reviews.Content: Tripped here in January 2012 for a 3 night business stay. The hotel really is great...lots of old character. Something you don't run into in your everyday hotels. First off, location is great, about a 15-20 ride from the airport. If you're interested, there is a bus stop that runs to the airport that is about 1 block away and it's cheap...$2.50. That will save you over a $15 cab ride. There are tons of great restaurants within walking distance. The only negative I would say is the hotel is located right next to some type of concert place. Each night walking back to the hotel, there were long lines of young kids and most of them appeared intoxicated and even witnessed one girl vomiting on the sidewalk. I was alone so I didn't care, but with the wife and kids I would have been a little apprehensive. Check-in was a breeze and finding my room was easy. Elevators were quick and there were several of them so I didn't have to wait too long for one to stop at my floor. The room was nice, but the view unfortunately was of the backside of the hotel so all I really saw were rooms across the way and the top of a lower level roof. Bathroom was spacious and appeared updated. Overall, I was impressed with the room. Business side of travel was also well done. First off, the hotel does have wireless internet so be sure to get the password from the front desk as it changed daily. They also offer wired internet for free in the rooms so I was able to do all my business work at night. The meeting rooms in the basement were nice, but the wireless signals were terrible. Everyone was pretty much relegated to checking emails in the lobby during breaks because it was extremely difficult to get a signal. Makes me wonder why many of the hotels I travel to seem to neglect wireless signals in their meeting rooms to their business clients. Overall, I was pleased with the hotel. Being as I'm not from San Diego I really can't say if this is the greatest location, but there seemed to be enough within walking distance for whatever you might be in the mood for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: puccablu
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time. Staff was fabulous. Friendly, professional. One bad situation, Saturday night the young guests on our floor were extremely loud, and woke us up at 2am. The next day we informed the front desk. They took note of it, and mentioned we should have notified them that same night. So I appreciated their words. We did our laundry there and my husband said detergent was available for free. Great room, clean, well organized and spacious. Breakfast was great. Many choices. Typical buffet style: bacon, pancakes, sausage, scrambled eggs, or the chef makes you a fresh omelet. The waitress was outstanding in her service. So polite and accomodating. The lobby is gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historical building, ok rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: jkf0807
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel building is actually an old bank; plenty of details in the old building, e.g. the high ceiling in the lobby/restaurant area, teller counters, the massive bank vault door and old maps of the West painted on walls. The rooms were average-to-good, no noise and clean and fairly new. Friendly staff and average offering of breakfast. The location is good, 5 min walk to the historical Gaslamp district with plenty of eateries and bars, and 15 min to the train station and/or waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and Price of any Marriott in the area”
Reviews.Author: beckyorjake
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in the Marriott Courtyard Downtown because of the description of the hotel as a renovated bank with unique architecture and, also, because it was less expensive than the Marriott Marina and Courtyard Gaslamp. We loved the hotel, the location, and the service we received during our stay and would recommend it over the other choices. We stayed at the Marriott Marina for our last two nights and paid quite a bit more per night but still preferred the Courtyard Downtown. This hotel was beautiful inside, perfectly located for public transportation with the tram only 1 block away, restaurants literally everywhere and all in walking distance made it perfect for food, same for shopping with the addition of a huge mall within just 5 blocks or so. Also, the fact that it was smaller than the Marriott Marina made everything seem much more pleasant and quiet--perfect for hanging out in the early morning or evening. The parking is expensive but that is pretty much the case in any hotel in this downtown/gaslamp/bay area. I was a little concerned when I made my reservation because the rate was less than the other Mariotts but found you can save a little and still have a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “It had great potential but is a little cold in decor.”
Reviews.Author: ButteryBiscuitBase
Reviews.Content: Impressive lobby with the old bank teller windows and the high ceiling. It just felt a bit cheapened though by the decor and the layout. Staff helpful. Room again with the decor and layout it felt a bit hospital like. I'm not sure if its standard in America but you have no choice but to use the valet, and at $33 a night its not the cheapest.

Reviews.Title: “Great guest service”
Reviews.Author: mineesnowtah
Reviews.Content: The front of the hotel (where you park your car to valet and the sign is located) is actually on 6th. Not knowing this we drove around before calling for directions. From that phone call on, the customer service of the Courtyard Marriott staff impressed us! Check in was quick and clerk offered us a few places we should check out in Gaslamp. The hotel itself was an old bank so the character is fun! Rooms were clean and spacious. We forgot a bottle opener, called down to the desk and within 5 minutes they had the bellman at our door with a bottle and wine opener! Great fitness center and apparently a great place for meetings...neither which I used, but touring them and hearing from ither guest...another great amenetiy. Location is within walking distance to the 5th street trolley station and fun restaurants.com. Would stay here again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “The Host with the Most!!”
Reviews.Author: Dinelocally
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Marriott Courtyard in the Gaslamp district of San Diego and both times have been blown away by the facility's historic significance and its staff. The star of the staff is Nick McQueen! Nick, is something special. The first time my wife and I met Nick we had just finished working out and were admiring the conference room. Nick offered to show us more of the property and did a full-out tour of the beautiful facility. This was enough to make us zealots about this property, but about a month later I walked into the hotel and there at the front desk was Nick, who greeted me by name! How in the world did he do that?? Well, with a fellow like Nick active in the front of the property, this is going to remain my favorite property in San Diego. Thanks Nick and Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location, historical building”
Reviews.Author: Tyal
Reviews.Content: From the "way beyond" expected helpful, friendly, friendly front desk staff of Meg and Rachel to the awesome historical tour of the historical bank building by Nicolas, this hotel more than exceeded our expectations. Courteous staff went out of their way to help us. The historical building with hand-painted ceiling, marble, and rich history set it apart from regular hotels. Located in the downtown Gas Lamp corridor near Horton Plaza , it is an ideal home base for enjoying and touring San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel that was a bank.”
Reviews.Author: Barbaradventure
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard by Marriott used to be a bank. The teller windows now are the front desk. The vault can hold small meetings of 12 people. The bank architect has not lost it's charm on the Courtyard. The hotel is centrally located. The hotel room was spacious and comfortable. The location is 2 blocks from the trolley. This trolley can take you to the boarder of Mexico to the northern part of San Diego. The bus to the airport is just around the corner. Restaurants and nite time entertainment are a casual stroll down Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “There are cheerier hotels in town”
Reviews.Author: Don322
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate($139) for a midweek king room in January, but the sticker shock of the $33 valet parking fee, with no self park option, was a bad start to our experience. The hotel is in a newly gentrirfied part of town(6th and Broadway), a few blocks north of the gaslamp area, but there are still plenty of bums and panhandlers on the block. The rooms in general are dark, with a pretty horrendous taupe carpet with a dizzying pattern of dark brown curlicues. We first got assigned to 301, a mini-suite with the bedroom sharing a wall with the elevator shaft, and the living room a few feet above the noisy A/C units in the dark air shaft. We went back to the front desk, and got put in a room on the 10th floor. When we walked in, the lampshade from the lamp on the desk was sitting on the far side of the desk, as opposed to on the lamp. Doesn't housekeeping check a room before it is assigned to make sure it is all together? When I walked into the bathroom, it smelled like it had recently been used --- not pleasant, but by that time it was after midnight and we just wanted to sleep. The room was big but the old wooden furniture and the old wooden door were all a tad depressing. There is an eight-step starcase from the check-in desk to the room elevator, so not so good if you do not want to climb and descend stars with yourr luggage. We bailed before the $15 buffet breakfast,figuring that San Diego is such a beautiful, light and airy city, why stay longer in a dark place.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: tikidream
Reviews.Content: Earlier in the week, I was staying at another hotel for work for about three times what I paid a night at this gem of a hotel. Staff were nice and helpful, location great and room was a good size. We did not order room service or eat at the hotel, but the free morning coffee was good and appreciated! Back to price and location- you are a block away from one of the trolley lines, a 15 minute walk to the harbor/promenade area; a block or two from the center of the Gaslamp area and an easy few blocks to the other trolley line. The bus stop right outside the hotel takes you directly to Balboa Park and all the wonderful things there. The room was a good size- we had two double beds and plenty of room to walk around, bathroom clean, towels good. Unlike others we didn't hear any noise once we were in our room. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Gaslamp Marriott Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: ksofka
Reviews.Content: By way of introduction, I booked this fabulous hotel because I was flying in to give a deposition and it was one block from my client. So...I did proximity and thought the hotel would be dumpy as it was only $93.00 per month. Boy, was I wrong. It is housed in a historic building and was a former bank. Where you check are the old tellers windows. The restaurant is central to the lobby which has a three foot tall central area with carvings and statues and its just a wonderful space in which to eat. The restaurant staff, particularly Lupita and Felipe are attentive and very amable. The check-in staff are efficient. The bellman, Terrance, was knowledgeable and cordial. The lady on the night shift who did my printing was incredibly fast. The rooms were impeccable. What I adored was the renovation of the space and how effectively Marriott completed the renovation. There was not one instance of lacksidasical service...not one. I will go back (non-business) and stay there again. What a treat (and I travel a great deal for business, happening to adore Marriott).

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!! What a lobby!”
Reviews.Author: themishmans
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the staff accommodating. It was very clean. The lobby is beyond amazing and is by far the nicest lobby of any Courtyard I have ever stayed. I found the walls in the room a bit thin. We heard some interesting things from the rooms next door. The first night was some very spirited bedroom activity with excessive banging. The second night was a loud relationship breakup including hysterical sobbing. I am not sure if both came from the same people in the same room. Nevertheless, my children enjoyed the unplanned entertainment. ;) Overall, a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, good service, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Amanda_McM
Reviews.Content: Hotel building and presentation is absolutely gorgeous; the building used to be a bank and still has some of the features intact. The accommodation is very comfortable, staff are professional, friendly and helpful. Location is in down town, close to many restaurants and a few minutes walk from the trolley (public transport). The early morning complimentary coffee, available in the lobby, was a treat and very tasty too. Buffet breakfast was adequate, not the best value and the happy hour choices were not that exciting. Free wifi is only available in public areas; although internet access is free to guests it is by wired access in rooms. Access is fast and reliable, but wifi would be preferable - needs an upgrade. There was some night time noise from street and adjoining rooms. Other than that I was very satisfied indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Historical Location Combined with an Extraordinary Staff!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugNatalie
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott associate myself, I am subconsciously observant of the environment and service provided while lodging at any brand of hotel, motel, resort, b&b, etc. I had such a wonderful experience at this Marriott location that I feel obligated to share my experience. My stay was actually back in the summer of 2011. I live here in San Diego and my family came to visit for a wedding. We decided to stay downtown to be next to the wedding and couldn't be happier about our decision! From the minute we pulled up to valet to the minute we departed we were provided OUTSTANDING service! Nicholas in particular has an above and beyond personality! He made us feel comfortable with his sense humor and knowledge. Two other associates Ashley and Brandon were extremely friendly and helpful with my requests prior to and during our stay. The location is truly one of a kind. This building was formerly the historical bank, San Diego Trust and Savings. This Courtyard by Marriott has done a fabulous job by keeping the structural design in tact and actually embracing it. This is what makes this hotel such a one of kind. My father owns and operates a commercial and residential construction and development company. I couldn't have taken him a better hotel as he in particular took to the beautiful and unique architecture. I stay at many different brands of hotels. This is an example of why my first choice is to stay at Marriott. It is not just because I can stay on a more than reasonable rate, but because the service and environment are consistently amazing. I have had my fair share of experiences that were subpar, however for the past year or so, Marriott continues to be provide the incredible service that we all desire and expect during our lodging experiences. Thank you again to Nicholas, Ashley, and Brandon! I will return! -Your Neighbor Natalie

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Deb M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott San Diego Downtown for 2 nights. The staff was great (Erick in the restaurant and Steve at Valet, and others who's name we did not get) as was the room and atmosphere. The hotel was once a bank and many of the original items are still there. The room was large, very clean, and the bed was comfortable. It is also convenient to the Gaslamp district, Little Italy, Balboa park, the zoo, and the harbor, all within walking distance. We plan to stay there each time we visit San Diego. Parking is extra, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Building, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zw2l
Reviews.Content: This is a converted bank from the 1920s, so the lobby and hallways have a retro charm. Otherwise this is a strictly average hotel. We got a room for about $120 a night, which i believe is well below their normal rate. I don't think it is worth any more than we paid. Nothing wrong with the hotel, except that the bed was quite saggy and the pillows were not very comfortable: both me and my girlfriend had sore backs in the moring. On the plus side, the staff were quite friendly, and the location was good for visiting the gaslamp district.

Reviews.Title: “The best part is it's CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: fug123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend. The place is spotless!! The place has a very good buffet breakfast also. Kind of cool how they turned this old bank into a hotel. Next time out there would for sure stay there.......

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes it seem like being at home”
Reviews.Author: Treborw
Reviews.Content: I often travel to San Diego, and when I do, I stay at the Courtyard Dowtown. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The location is on the North end of the Gaslamp Quarter which means you can walk easily to a wide variety of outstanding restaurants. There is plenty of nice spots or nightlife as well. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, but parking stinks!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel1980
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal through priceline on a room here during our recent vacation to San Diego. I understand parking is an issue in any major city, but the 33 dollar mandatory valet parking price was terrible. There was no were else in the area to park so you were forced to pay it, and the parking was more then half the price of what we paid for our room. The rooms are very small, which is normal for downtown, but my husband and I were pretty cramped. Luckily we didnt have to spend much time in there other then to sleep and shower. Our shower handle was functioning properly and kept falling from warm to scaulding, which could have been a huge liabilty if there was a child in there. We reported to them but we were getting ready to leave so told them they could fix it after. The building is very old and has lots of history. We got to go up to the tower on the roof and see the great views. The staff was very accomidating and it was in a good location, however I probably wouldnt stay here again willingly unless we won it on priceline again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Courtyard San Diego Downtown NOVEMBER 2011”
Reviews.Author: Alison M
Reviews.Content: Stayed NOV 2011 4 nights Fabulous building and I'd like to that Danny for a great tour. I'm a Travel Agent and always look at hotels with a critical eye. Loved the wonderful historic building and admired Marriott for keeping so much of the original features during it's renovation. Staff were fantastic and great with kids even though they probably don't see so many in a Downtown location. Walking distance to shopping, eats and Gaslamp area. Beds were very comfortable, and a good size, use of free internet in the room always a winner. Breaksfast is available in the restaurant downstairs and they do bar service in the evenings. Loved have access to laundry facilites as we travelled California for two weeks and was in great need of clean clothers. If you are staying in the Downtown area then I would recommend it. Clearly aimed at the buisness market

Reviews.Title: “A sad decline of a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mac k
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here at least once a year since 2003, and loved the hotel. But I think I have to break the habit. The removal of wireless from the rooms is completely unacceptable. If they rectify this, I will come back. Also, as a Gold member, I have received subpar rooms on my last two stays. I did better as a Silver Elite member in the past, and my rates were no higher.

Reviews.Title: “Week Dec. 18-24th”
Reviews.Author: SD2011Bob
Reviews.Content: Thus facility is top notch and a very historic building. The staff all were wonderful, as im a Platimum member with Marriott ive seen many Courtyards but i would rate staff here the best. We had a hotel kitchen fire and the Concierge Nicolas McQueen was outstanding and very helpful. A true profeesional, i tthought he was the General manager until i ask for his card.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at the Marriott Courtyard in Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: linda f
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this Marriott and again the rooms, service and experience was wonderful. The room was very clean and comfortable. All of the employees were friendly, helpful, professional and made me feel very welcome. In addition, this hotel is walking distance to the Gas Lamp district, Little Italy, shopping, the marina area and Balboa Park. When I return to San Diego I will again stay at this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: peachberry7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night on a recent anniversary trip to So Cal. I had stayed here once before and loved everything about it, so hence why it was booked again. You really can't beat the location!! It's super easy to get to from the airport, but it you get there at a busy time, it can be a bit tricky getting in/out of the valet parking lane. $33 for the valet parking is a bit steep in my opinion, but it is what it is. Oh, and you can now text the valet when you're ready for your car so that was convenient. The hotel building itself it very beautiful as it used to be an old bank. Very historic! The rooms are typical of what you'd find at a Courtyard. Yeah, again you just can't beat the location!! It's such an easy walk to nearby restaurants and shopping. This is definitely my go-to hotel for trips to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite for Business in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: On-the-road-again79
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Diego for business often, and always stay at this hotel - a former bank building nicely converted to a hotel - when rooms are available. I have never been disappointed. Rooms are clean, quiet, and nicely furnished. As a Marriott Rewards member, the hotel often treats me to a free breakfast or desert in their restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great place & location”
Reviews.Author: mhickman184
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott San Diego Downtown for 2 nights. We loved it! It was only about a 10-12 minute walk to the San Diego Convention Center which is why we came into town. It is located near the Gaslamp District with many different restaurants, bars, and clubs very close by. The hotel service was great. No complaints. They held our bags for us after we had already checked out, and loaded our car for us. Overall, this was an amazing place to stay. We'll definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: SlotF16
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 10pm on a Fri night and Nicholas was more than helpful checking us in. He even escorted us to our room since we had to change elevators on the 14th floor! He as well as the front desk staff went out of the way to answer questions on the local area. They a provided a Gaslamp district map and directed us to a great Irish pub "Stout" up the street. The room was clean, modern and comfortable with all of the standard amenities. Great location, great hotel. Will stay here again next time I am in town. 14th floor was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 4 nights, Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: The1Key
Reviews.Content: Nice location in downtown San Diego. Easy to get on the trolley, just one block away. Very nice room, great staff that was always helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda G
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Courtyard by Marriott San Diego Downtown provided us with amazing service, clean and comfortable rooms, and a vacation we will never forget. If you have a chance, take the time to explore the hotel or ask Nicholas, the wonderful concierge, for a tour! =)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: IdMan
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden jewel when it comes to hotels in San Diego. The are many other hotels in the surrounding area, but I think I stumbled on the best. The building itself has great character; it was once a bank building. The lobby and dining areas are the great hall of the once glorious bank. This hotel is situated in a great spot, a great cross roads. It sits a top 4th, 5th and 6th Avenues - these are the streets where almost all the night life happens. Any type of restaurant, bar, art studio, and theater --- you can find it on these streets. At the end of 5th Ave is the Convention Center and at the end of 6th is Petco Park, home of the Padres. The public transportation is also great in San Diego and all the major bus and lightrail lines run in front and behind the hotel. It is a 10 minute bus ride to Balboa Park or Hillcrest. Top the location with a very friendly and accomodating staff! I rented a bicycle while I was there and they watched over it as I ran in and out plus stored it for me over night. I will definitely stay here again. This was a business trip, to attend a conference in a hotel out by the airport. I thought I was being short-changed by needing to take the bus every morning. But it was great because the hotel by the airport is cut-off from the nightlife. I truely got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: Urmysunshine1935
Reviews.Content: I ant even begin to tell you all of the little things that were done to make this stay special. First, we stayed in a very upscale hotel a few days prior and they couldn't touch the service or the accommodations that this Courtyard had. I was pleasantly surprised by every one of the staff members I encountered there. I took the time to tell the general manager, Jodie, about my experience and she was so kind and appreciative. So much so that a gorgeous piece of chocolate cake and a very nice note was sitting in my room waiting on us when we got back in for the evening. I'd love to co e back and stay here again. If you do, make sure you ask them to give you a tour of the rooftop. It's an amazing view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ButtonsH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights recently over a weekend. Great stay... the hotel is an old converted bank and they have done a lovely job in refurbishing the main hall into the lobby completely re-using all the existing marble. All the old teller windows complete with mini marble columns are still there. IT is lovely and open. Hotel is a great location for restaurants etc. in the Gaslamp quarter could walk to restaurants every night and the Horton Plaza is just five min. walk along Broadway. The ho-on hop-off trolley is right there outside Horton Plaza within walking distance and it was great for getting around the city and sightseeing; we used it for two days. Hotel very clean and comfortable and rooms typical hotel furniture and size we had no issues there. Staff very helpful when asked for anything. The only thing was in a tourist city they have NO tourist information out and you had to ask for any maps etc. from the front desk. The attendant said they had it all in the back but you have to know what to ask for then. Tourist information should be out and more visible. All in all a great stay and prices were very reasonable compared to other Gaslamp hotels. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: Beautifully refurbished 1928 Bank of San Diego Building. Very friendly staff, especially Terrance who gave us a very informative tour (bank vaults, vintage photos, the tower looking out onto San Diego and more). Two blocks from the Gaslamp District and Horton Plaza Shopping. The room was clean and spacious. I have to say one of the nicest hotels I've stayed at. This property should be a J.W. Marriott Resort not a Courtyard! Wireless Internet would be nice in the rooms although they do have wired connections..

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Fotocrazyoma
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, close to down town activities. Within walking distance of hundreds of restaurants, bars and shops but far enough away that it feels like a getaway. We sent the first day hiking and caught a Padre's game and an evening downtown. Second breakfast downown and a day kayaking. Nice weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Just a few blocks from the Gas Lamp District”
Reviews.Author: jb645
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend back in the summer. As you first walk in, the lobby is very grand and the setting is very much a grand bank back in its day. Check in process was okay. The hallways leading up to your room are very quiet and the décor is very much living to that very old bank décor. The room is basic, clean, and the bed is comfortable. The bathroom is a large size. No frills come to mind when staying in the room. The best things about staying here were the close proximity to the Gas Lamp district and the rate was reasonable compare to other hotels in the area. It was a nice walk down 5th Ave. to find a place for dinner as the nightlife was getting started. The breakfast buffet was part of the room rate. The buffet had the usual breakfast items and included an omelet station. The servers were very attentive and friendly. When you eat at the restaurant on site, that’s when you really admire the architecture of the former bank as you are surrounded by it. The ceilings and indoor windows are a sight to see. The valet guys were very helpful in giving us directions, restaurant recommendations, and getting us a cab. Just down the block is a trolley station, 5th Ave. and took the blue trolley line to go to Old Town. At night, be cautious when walking right around the hotel. The surrounding area has some shady characters and gets very deserted. The neighborhood does get better as you walk towards to the Gas Lamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable restored bank building”
Reviews.Author: pdclarry
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Downtown is in a restored bank building, right on the edge of the Gaslamp district. It's a block from the trolley, and on several bus lines, so the location couldn't be better. The original bank lobby has been retained, and reused as a bar, restaurant and performance space. Some of the rooms on the lower floors face an air shaft, but most are high enough for a view or face the street. Our room was large, comfortable, and the bathroom was huge and well stocked. The bed appeared new and was a very comfortable pillow-top. The food is mediocre and the menu standard, but that doesn't matter because there are dozens of excellent restaurants within a 5 minute walk, including several excellent breakfast places. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the security seemed excellent (we returned to our room while it was being cleaned, and the housekeeper closed the door and asked us to use our key to enter). We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Monstrously comfortable, historic bank building,”
Reviews.Author: 94Q45T
Reviews.Content: First, don't use the street address in a GPS. There is no indication on Broadway that you've reached the hotel. The actual awning is on 6th, just around the corner, and that is where the valet parking is. Use 1000 6th avenue instead. Once there, though, expect a very comfortable stay, helpful staff. My room, 106, was very spacious, and the king bed was literally the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever experienced (I travel almost weekly). There is a variety of restaurants in close walking distance, though the downtown area nearby is unimpressive. The original character of the bank is maintained, complete with teller windows and a large vault now used as a meeting room. The lobby has been meticulously restored, and it is full of architectural detail. It is ornate yet cozy at the same time and a very nice change from cookie cutter chain properties. My room had plenty of space for an armoir, two overstuffed chairs, an ottoman, desk and office chair. The TV is in the armoir which is at a right angle to the bed. It does not extend out to it is not possible to watch TV from the bed and see the whole screen. Minor issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diago”
Reviews.Author: lovetovacation075
Reviews.Content: This is a nicely situated hotel beautifully converted from an old bank, lots of marble and beautiful teller's cages, wood panelling in the elevators, and very friendly, helpful staff. My husband and I are on a road trip of California, looking for upscale accommodations at bargain prices. This can be done via internet. Our room was huge, with a huge bathroom. Everything was spotlessly clean. Free coffee, free internet and free newspaper, comfortable bed, pillows and bedding. We prefer to do our own parking, and looking after our own luggage, but being a busy street downtown, this is not possible at this location. We had to use the valet parking and the attendant service. We had a nice view of the roof tops of downtown San Diago. We felt safe at this location, were within walking distance to the gaslamp area and all the great restaurants with outdoor dining. We were also able to walk the distance to the water front to see the sites there, about a 10 block walk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quirky (in a good way)”
Reviews.Author: pwierz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one you will remember staying in after you leave. It used to be an old bank building that was converted into a hotel. It definitely has the retro vibe without feeling old or dated. Walking through the hall to your room almost feels like you're walking in a 1960s office building (again, not in a bad way). The rooms are clean and the staff is very polite and helpful. The location is great right at the top of the Gaslamp so you have plenty of restaurant and bar options. This is the place I stay every time I have business in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJambo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights to attend a conference at the convention center. The hotel is a brisk 10-15 minute walk downhill to the center itself, so is perfectly located. It is also right in the Gaslamp quarter, so within easy distance of pubs, restaurants and shops. As a lot of people mention, this place used to be a bank, and many of the features have been retained to give it something of a unique '30s feel (not to say the rooms are old fashioned or anything - they are not). The rooms are large, clean and comfortable and from a higher floor have a pretty good view. As another reviewer mentioned, there is a lack of wireless but free LAN, which I am assuming is due to the thickness of the walls making it impossible! The staff at this hotel are phenomenal and this sets it apart from good to great. On check-in I asked if there was any pub where I could watch a rugby match which only started at 1230AM that night. The staff (sorry, don't recall the names) immediately called several bars and came up blank. However, when I returned to the hotel after dinner, I was called over to be told they had kept calling around and had also left a message in my room that there was indeed an Irish bar showing the match. This is really excellent and impressive level of service for a fairly minor request and definitely gets you an extra star as impeccable service immediately earns a credit from me! The valet service was also great (although not cheap!) Overall, a good stay, great location, unique hotel, and would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jennie H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family for a first time trip to San Diego. Nice hotel. Very convenient. It is within walking distance of so many restaurants. Horton Plaza is just a short walk away with shopping and places to eat. There is also an Old Town Trolley stop that took us all around San Diego. The greatest thing about the hotel is the friendly staff. We never walked in the door without being greeted by the front desk and anyone else we passed. The history is interesting and the staff loves to share it. We were given a tour by Nicholas - he even took us to the roof at night to let us see the lights of San Diego- beautiful!! This will be our first choice if ever in San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BobB53
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated right in the gaslamp quarter of San Diego so all the bars and restaurants are within walking distance. Hotel rooms and corridors look a little old fashioned (it was a bank) but they are perfectly OK. Staff on the front desk very helpful and knowledgeable. We booked very late so I think we paid a bit too much but I'm sure there are deals out there.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I've been to!”
Reviews.Author: yopi
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels I’ve been to. The building used to be a bank, and has been amazingly renovated. The lobby is beautiful, maintaining the teller stations and has a beautifully decorated high ceiling. They have all the old time charm (wood paneling, nice elevators, etc.), but very nicely renovated. They even still have the vault downstairs, which serves as a meeting room, and old fashioned wooden telephone booths. The rooms are fine, typical Courtyard: good sized, you can get a fridge if you ask for one, nice bathroom, tv, etc. Everyone is extremely friendly and helpful. Considering I got there half an hour before the San Diego power outage, and having been there under exceptional hard times, I have nothing but praises for the staff, both in the good times and the bad!!! Only minus: though you have free access to internet in rooms via cable), there is only wifi access in the public areas, which is not to convenient if you've got an iPad or tablet. Excellent location, great breakfast buffet, nice bar.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good service with history thrown in”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSam04
Reviews.Content: If you're an architecture buff, or just like buildings with a story to tell... This one is for you. A standard Marriott hotel (clean, neat, all the mod cons) in a converted bank building. Make sure you do the tour of the bank vault. Location is good.., walk to the main restaurant and nightlife area, and Westfield!

Reviews.Title: “The history, location, and service is great! Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: UTALMN
Reviews.Content: This was an incredible trip for me and my best friends. I’ve stayed at Marriots all over the world, but this was a truly unique experience. This is actually an old 1920’s bank that has been remodeled and a lot of the original artifact has been well kept so the entire ambiance is very unique. Staff and service was very accommodating, professional, and made us all feel very welcomed. The history of this building is really what set this stay apart from the typical other swanky downtown options. I do recommend this hotel, such an original historic site!

Reviews.Title: “Great Lobby and History - Ends When you Walk in to Your Room”
Reviews.Author: ATLJetSetter
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a lot of Courtyards and usually they provide a comfortable room and a few perks and some great service - when I stumbled upon this Courtyard it caught my eye with the awesome history and architectural details. I will say the lobby is very impressive as is the hotel bar (closes very early though... so it's not really of much use). I was also able to take a tour of the downstairs with the old vault etc... However, the first night we were there, our AC broke and started making this horrible loud noise around 3:30 in the morning (which somehow did not wake my friend up though I felt like a helicopter was landing in the room). After being unable to figure out how to make it stop, I went down to the front desk upon which they sent someone up to confirm the noise. After being unable to make it stop I was given the room next door and told my friend could move over whenever they woke up and we could move our stuff in the morning. This was not the case - maintenance let themselves in before 8 in the morning and then the front desk told me I had to get up and move my stuff immediately or I would be charged for 2 rooms. Not really the kind of customer service I would look for in a $200/night Courtyard or really any Marriott property. I shrugged it off and figured I'd say something about it when I checked out (thinking I'd give them the benefit of the doubt and maybe they'd discount that night on my room bill) - not even close to the case. When asked how my stay was I told the manager on duty about the problem and was given a "thats too bad" and sent on my way. Check out the Marriott - Gaslamp Quarter. Great Roof Top bar and service was much better!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: TravelGalSP
Reviews.Content: Had a great girls weekend recently and the staff was great, from getting our rooms next to each other, to taking photos, and recommending great places to dine. Rooms are great and the ambiance the best. Shout out to Nick, the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: sdsugoldengirl
Reviews.Content: Great service. Rooms were nice sized. Loved the reception desk--old bank teller windows. Excellent location right in the heart of Gaslamp Quarter. Concierge Nicolas McQueen was so helpful and accommodating. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Clary17
Reviews.Content: There was a power blackout all over southern California during the second night of my stay. The staff did a fantastic job taking care of its patrons, giving them bottled water, snacks, etc given that there was no running water or power from 4PM on through the next day. They were calm and cool in the face of a challenging situation!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel , very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SLKspingirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an old bank building. Gorgeous structure. Staff is very helpful friendly and really responded beautifully in the blackout. This was also one of the only downtown hotels that had good emergency power. We still had an elevator, lights in lobby, stairs and corridors. It made surviving the outage much easier than it might have been otherwise. Lower level rooms have better sound proofing from street noise. Third floor was quiet. Room right above on 12th floor had more street noise. Negatives would be the $30 a day for valet and small standard rooms. Very small. And no wi-fi in the rooms, only in lobby. That was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guy M
Reviews.Content: Many positives about this hotel: location amenities service housekeeping You would never know the age of this building (historic building) by the modernization and upkeep. To top it off, it was the best deal in the downtown area within walking distance to the Gaslamp District.

Reviews.Title: “Very different but great beds!”
Reviews.Author: PokeMomNJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while we visited San Diego. The hotel is located in an old bank so it felt like we were staying at Gringotts Bank from Harry Potter. The rooms were not as clean as I hoped for but two things made up for that....a strong shower and a really good bed/mattress. The evening front desk manager was rude but the day managers were all fantastic. Also, the bell hop outside provided great service. The price was very good, $159 per night and the hotel is close to many spots....the Gaslamp district, Sea World, the Zoo and about a mile to the harbor. It is a good solide 3-star hotel but no more.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, awesome building!”
Reviews.Author: D3013
Reviews.Content: All of the nice things that others have said about this hotel and its staff are true but the absolute best reason to stay here is the building itself. Marriott did a great thing by preserving the lobby and vaults (now converted into meeting rooms) of this early 20th century bank. It is also evident that these preservation efforts are a source of pride for the management and staff. Bellman/Concierge Nick McQueen gave me an incredibly detailed tour of the lobby and vaults along with a chance to see the city and bay from the rooftop cupola. He even had a ghost story. Amazing. I was totally blown away. I'll recommend this place to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Had The Best Time Ever and Will Be Back!!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy B
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful historic hotel located in downtown San Diego. The staff was wonderful - especially Nick, Ashley, Alexis and Brandon! They took care of us whenever anything was needed. Everyone was very friendly! The rooms were very nice and we had a beautiful view of downtown. They have a great breakfast in the dining room!! Try the french toast - its so good!! The hotel has great access to the restaurants, shopping and the trolley. We will be back and definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: PattyBender
Reviews.Content: We checked out of our room on 8/16 and had the hotel keep our luggage until late in the day as we were taking a red eye flight back to Charlotte, NC. We had a conference all day and came back to the hotel for our luggage and a hotel staff person offered to give us a room to use to change and freshen up for our flight back to Charlotte. It was so wonderful to be able to change into comfortable clothes and freshen up to prepare for an all night flight. This was the best hotel experience we have ever encountered and so grateful for hotel staff member, Bashir Ramsey for his generosity!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: sandra f
Reviews.Content: it is a old bank that has been remodeled it was beautifull. The staff was great and it was walking distance to horton plaza and the gas lamp distance

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Courtesy & Hospitality, Can't Wait To Visit Again!!”
Reviews.Author: DMFK__77
Reviews.Content: Having been a resident of San Diego for over 12 years, and having recently moved away, I have enjoyed a great many trips to the historic Gaslamp Quarter for casual dates, romantic dates, nights out with friends, and even stayed a night or two in a few of the highest end hotels (Ivy, Hard Rock, San Diego Marriott Marquis & Marina, etc); however, not a single one of them even holds a candle to the warm and comfy experience at Courtyard Downtown! Immediately upon entering the lobby of this grand historic hotel, one is filled with a sense of awe and grandeur at it's glorious past. Assuming that I would get a stuffy welcome upon check-in, I was very pleasantly surprised at the high-energy and ease of rapport with Bellman/Concierge Nicholas McQueen who checked us in. He was helpful in ascertaining our needs for finding us just the right room, then very efficiently handled the check-in, chatting about local nightlife & entertainment venues all-the-while. We found our room to be very clean, and the perfect size for entertaining a few friends who visited for a cocktail before heading out for our night on the town. The proximity to the gaslamp quarter's finest entertainment spots was perfect, and we had and extraordinarily fun evening. After calling it a night, we headed back into the hotel lobby, where we were warmly greeted by Bashir Ramzy. He went above and beyond his role as a front desk clerk, and spent the time to help us find the perfect spot for a late Sunday morning brunch... he even listened while we spun tales of our TMZ style exploits at the nightclubs earlier that evening! Our room was quiet, the bed soft & cozy, and we slept wonderfully. Our morning check out was smooth & painless, and the complimentary gourmet coffee in the lobby was a nice touch to help wash away the bleariness of the previous evenings hijinx (We were to groggy to use the coffee pot supplied in our room). I phoned in later to square things away on my billing and was quickly & efficiently helped by Raina, who was extremely courteous & professional, but with a charming ease. Thanks to all the staff at Courtyard Downtown for a perfect stay, and I can't wait to enjoy another night there very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way”
Reviews.Author: Robert P
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay was to celebrate our 42 anniversary. The staff made this experience very pleasant. Bashur was so kind and sent up a very special gift to our room in honor of this special event. The staff were so friendly and accomidating. The room was very pleasant, and every request was responded to in a timely manner. We so enjoyed our stay and look forward to a future return. I believe that this was the most pleasant stay that we have ever had at any hotel. Thank you. Dr. Robert Proctor

Reviews.Title: “Nicest people work here!”
Reviews.Author: cookiebabe
Reviews.Content: We had arrived early but were lucky enough to get a room. Everyone there was helpful and pleasant. We used the Valet parking (easiest) and all the young men were very careful with our suv and also helped us with directions . The breakfast at the Hotel was very good. Nothing is cheap in CA but at least it was worth not having to walk anywhere before we spent two days walking Balboa Park!!! Oh it is in an old BEAUTIFUL bank, marble in the lobby. Very interesting to look at the architecture!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Northwoods_Legend
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the downtown Marriott Courtyard a number of times and it never disappoints. The staff is tremendous - very friendly and helpful with whatever you need. The building itself is very cool as it used to be an old bank and they have tried to preserve quite a bit of it. The rooms are always clean and and have enough room for you to put your bag(s) out and move around. I have always stayed there alone however and can see how the room could get cramped with multiple people in it. You can't beat the location. If heading to the convention center, it's an easy 10 minute walk. You are far enough out of the Gaslamp District where you don't get all the tourists but are close enough to hang out there if you wish. There are some very good restaurants and bars within walking distance and one of the trolley stops is a block away. I will not hesitate to stay here again and again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, probably wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: co_native29
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June for a quick weekend trip with my sister. The actual hotel is gorgeous, it is an old building and lobby is beautiful. The rooms on the other hand were just so so. The beds were not very comfortable and overall it could have used an update. The location is fantastic, right in the Gaslamp district, in walking distance to pretty much everything. The biggest problem I had was the noise. There are a lot of people coming in at all hours of the night and are very loud. If you are going to be one of those people, then this hotel would be fine for you. However, I did not enjoy getting woken up every night by drunken people. Not the hotels fault, but just would prefer to stay somewhere different next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff Ever!”
Reviews.Author: pcmendez99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days to enjoy the 4th of July festivities here. The hotel was converted from a bank which still has several large safes and maintains a large percentage of its original features. It reminds me of the buildings pictured in vintage movies. The hotel staff was probably the most attentive, professional and courteous that I have ever met. From the moment we arrived, immidiately they offered goody bags to my kids, provided help with our luggage, gave us information all while keeping a sincere smile during this very busy weekend. Throughout our stay, they continued to provide the best hospitality and even gave us a tour of what was once the bank. The hotel lobby is amazing. It has high ceilings with very detailed craftsmanship, so many details have been kept from its original construction. The rooms were good sized. The hallways, windows and rooms reminded me of what a New York apartment might look like, in a good way. I think that the construction of the building at that time called for thick walls, because this was the quietest room we have slept in. The hotel is located in a central location, there is a Rite Aid, CVS, 7 Eleven just around the corner. The rail system stops right around the corner as well. We walked from the hotel, through the Gaslamp Quarter to Seaport Village and it wasn't that far, maybe a 20 minute stroll. I liked the location, the service was amazing but I wished they had a pool. San Diego has many miles of beaches, but a pool would've saved us the trip/hassle of finding a parking space on such a busy weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Could not believe it was a courtyard. It was very fabulus, owesome.”
Reviews.Author: bhupenshah2
Reviews.Content: The building used to be a bank. It is very fabulus and owesome. It is a hisorical building and the Marriott has done a very good job in preserving it. This Courtyard is quite diferent than a "typical" Courtyard structure. The staff was extremly helpful including the front desk, bellman, cleaning crew. High speed internet was easily available and there were enough computers for general use. Bellman staff and the rceptionists were extremly helpful in giving out pointers fot the site seeing along with directions. The hotel is acceesible to highways eventhough being in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel staff I've ever met”
Reviews.Author: oliver2837
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a converted bank, with the original vault. Very unique. The best thing about the hotel is the quality of their staff, from valet to bellmen, to front desk. Everyone was extremely helpful and wanted us to have a great time. I wouldn't stay anywhere else when I go back to San Diego. Most helpful employee was Steve in valet.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back to this beautiful (and historic) hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fuzzy60_11
Reviews.Content: We had no idea when we booked this hotel how beautiful it is. It is a bank building that was built in 1929. It ws still in use when Marriott bought it about 12 years ago. Marriott has kept so much of the original building that upon entering the lobby, you swear you are back in time 80 years. It is huge. Be prepared for the big "AHHH" when you walk in. The rooms are updated, but keep with the old influence. The registration desk are old teller windows. The staff could not have been nicer. Be sure to ask for tour of old vault(which is now a conference room) and downstairs area. Danny enriched us with all the history. He is a fine asset to the hotel. As far as location goes, if you want to stay downtown, this is definitely the place to stay. The trolley station is a block away. We took the trolley to Old Town and back. The hotel is also across the street from the GasLamp District. So many places to visit within a few blocks. The hotel will definitely be our place to stay when we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: TotallyTink
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend stay for our 10th anniversary here. The room was very comfortable and the view was nice. The front desk staff was great. They sent strawberries and champagne to our room along with information on attractions we mentioned we would like to visit. They were very helpful with directions to area attractions. They also gave us a complementary refrigerator for our sodas. The restaurant in the hotel lobby serves breakfast and dinner. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet. It was $14 and included freshly made omelets, breakfast meats, fresh fruit, french toast, etc. and beverages. The hotel is centrally located to Gaslamp District restaurants. We were also able to walk to Seaport Village, the USS Midway and Balboa Park. Offsite valet parking is available. It is pricey at $30 per day but the service was efficient. I would definitely stay here again if I return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room”
Reviews.Author: mipesq
Reviews.Content: First I would like to say that the hotel is beautiful and the staff are extremely friendly, however the room was dirty. The carpet was not clean and the bathroom had hair from the previous guest. I had to make sure I made the water run in the shower for 5 minutes prior to getting in. However, the room service was quick and the food was delicious. In addition, the gym room had excellent equipement and the hotel is in an excellent location. I would not stay here again. For the price I would likely stay at the hotel on the water.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and we will return.”
Reviews.Author: JBarrows
Reviews.Content: Wanting to get away for some rest and relaxation we decided to try out the Courtyard by Marriott Downtown San Diego. This was a great choice !!! This hotel was much more than we could have imagined from the archicture of the building to the very friendly staff. From the moment we arrived we were treated in a superb manner, with easy check in to being taken to our room. Walking down the hall to our room was very impressive with the beautiful marble to the original wood doors on the rooms. This hotel is impeccably clean and very well maintained. Our room was the hotel standard, very clean with nice amenities, although late in our stay we were upgraded to the presidential suite for our last nights stay by Nicholas McQueen a Bellman/ Concierge and the manager Brandon Avants. Both of these gentlemen were more than gracious to my wife and me. Nicholas took us on a tour and explained the history of the building. We went to the vault and up to the bell tower where we experienced a great view of downtown San Diego. When we were upgraded to the suite it was the highlight of our stay. I recommend this hotel highly from the staff to the excellent location, as its walking distance to all of the Gaslamp districts restaurants and shops. We ate a couple of meals in the hotel and found the food to be above average for a hotel. Ask for a room that faces one of the streets for a nice view. We will stay here again on our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks!!!!! Can't wait to go back."”
Reviews.Author: ValerieBarrows
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights, the service was excellent and the staff were welcoming and friendly. Especially, Nicolas McQueen...he made our stay even more memorable, he gave us tour of the hotel which holds a great deal of history, he was friendly and helpful, he went above and beyond his duties to make our stay a great experience. His manager Bradon Avants also was great. The location could not be better. Walking distance to restaurants and shopping. The blueline tram is walking distance and gets you anywhere you want to go. The Zoo is a 10 minute drive. We stayed in standard room which was clean and comfortable and spent one night in the Presidental Suite that was absolutely beautiful. I love the history in this hotel, it is a beautiful place to stay. Housekeeping could be a little more attentive but our rooms were clean. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff, good meeting space”
Reviews.Author: ilikemarkers
Reviews.Content: I was pleased when I arrived at how nice the lobby decor was. Classy, yet comfortable. Their continental breakfast was excellent, and the location was convenient for anyone who wanted to explore the Gaslamp district. Everyone, from the complimentary shuttle driver to the front desk people to the head of catering, was so nice! They helped me ship packages, no hassle, and arrange my meeting room. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: heather154913
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located in downtown San Diego, close to the shopping mall and lots of great places to eat, have a glass of wine and enjoy the weather. Everything was within walking distance. There was even a 7 11 around the corner. It was just a short ride from the airport, $13.00 cab ride. We took both the bus and trolley which were less than a block from the hotel The inside of the hotel was a former bank, lots of marble tile , beautiful ceiling.. Very clean and quiet. Rooms were a good size and comfortable bed. Hotel staff very pleasant and helpful. Complimentary coffee in the morning and flavored water in the afternoon. Overall excellent value, location and clean. Would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lwine
Reviews.Content: Hotel is an old bank converted to a hotel, and done very nicely. It is an attractive place in a great location in the gaslamp district, close to everything downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip to San Diego Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Staci_Dingley
Reviews.Content: My friend and I needed a relaxing trip to San Diego after having a rough year. I chose this hotel because I really like Courtyard. This hotel exceeded my expectations 150%. I have never been treated so well at any other hotel. From the moment we pulled up to the valet parking area we were greeted as if we were very important people. The valet parking attendant, Ramon, was very efficient and welcoming. The bellman, Nick, was righ there unloading our luggage before I had much of a chance to get out of the car. I felt like they were waiting for me. The hotel itself was absolutely beautiful. I have been to many hotels but this, by far, was the cleanest. Check in was a breeze. As a former front desk clerk I always look at that. Ashley was very welcoming, efficient, and professional. When the bellman, Nick, brought our bags to our room he asked if we would like our ice chest filled with ice and even had a refrigerator and microwave brought up without our asking. The room was very, very clean, quiet, and comfortable. Breakfast was very good and room service brought up the tray at the exact specified time. The service provided by this hotel was more than exceptional. Nick provided a tour of this historic hotel that was once a bank and he was very informative and a great tour guide. The valet service was excellent. My car was brought around exactly when they said it would. I would recommend anyone to stay here. If you want a relaxing, clean, and all around wonderful hotel experience, this hotel has all of that and more!

Reviews.Title: “FREAKING LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LOVESDMARRIOT
Reviews.Content: There is no where else I will ever stay! The staff is awesome, the rooms are huge, and the location can't be beat if your down for late night partying and safe walking!!!

Reviews.Title: “1206”
Reviews.Author: cenorred
Reviews.Content: Rayna got us a great room that looked out at the ocean and we could see the coronado bridge. It sits in a little cove of three rooms. Breakfast great! Pass on other meals. Bar serves great drinks. Thanks to the girls who cleaned and made our room tidy and comfortable. Parking pricey-$30 a day

Reviews.Title: “It was an awesome visit and I'm returning for Comic Con!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hollywood001
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a business mandatory training session. I had never been to San Diego before this trip. It lived up to and beyond my expectations due to the staff at the CM - San Diego. Talk about a group of people who couldn't have been more friendlier, positive, outgoing and cheerful whether it was me rushing late in the morning to training or coming in after a night of exploring the city. I mostly ate at the restaurant and bar except when my colleagues and I ventured into the city. The room, service, amenities, etc. were excellent. Even though my company paid for this trip, the stay was so great, I'll be paying for my own in July upon my return. A special note of thanks to NICK, LAUREN, AND ERICA!!! I know I put them thru the paces at times but they were great and treated me like a queen.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: walkabout098
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice idea, but not a nice place to stay. It is loud and echoing and roooms are oddly laid out. The AC will only work if you are "moving in the room" so be prepared to wake up in a sweat. Despite some weak attemps at double-glazing (basically just put another window inside the existing window) the street noise in incredible.
