The fire department makes at least 3 to 5 full light and siren runs each night. Rooms are not ready when promised, staff does not call as promised when rooms are ready, you are constantly being "carded" by staff to ensure you are who you say you are (my id was checked twice during check-in). The proximity to Horton plaza makes it a hang out for street persons who harass you the second you walk out the door. Proximity to gaslamp means that folks come stumbling in shrieking at the top of their lungs at 2:30am... In addition absolutely no attention paid to my significantly premier status with Marriott. Last - internet connection is very weak and not wireless in rooms. All in all - way too much money for the "quality of the experience"...

Reviews.Title: “Great Gem in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: goliathtn
Reviews.Content: When you walk into this hotel you step back into the 1930's. Beautiful high ceilings in the lobby and murals on the ceilings. Very impressive. Checking in was interesting as they have the old teller windos from the bank up so you feel as if you making a transaction. Going to the room was interesting as the hallways are a bit creepy, only in the sense that they look like the halls from the movie the shining. The rooms are large and spacious and and beds were comfortable. The hotel is in a perfect location and within walking distance of many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time here was better than the first....”
Reviews.Author: fpgirl
Reviews.Content: Sorry this is so late - thought I had already reviewed it... This was our 2nd stay at this Courtyard and was much better than our first....that time we were next to a room with a Mom and at least 3 children, some of whom were very loud (crying, screaming, maybe jumping on the bed which must have been on the connecting wall of our unit).....we didn't mention this to the staff since we were only there for 1 night. This time our room was 'upgraded' so we were in a handcap-equipped unit and both the bathroom and the living/sleeping area were much larger. Furnishings were appropriate but I'd still like a second chair for sitting, not just the desk chair. We had dinner in the bar in the lobby and it was very good and opted to have breakfast at the hotel, as well. Service was attentive in both areas. I appreciate the free internet in the lobby since I don't like lugging my laptop on vacation. We feel comfortable in the hotel but not so much out on the street - that's the only negative about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Weekend Parking”
Reviews.Author: fsfamily
Reviews.Content: Great hotel staff, location couldn't be better. 2 miles from Zoo, 3 miles Airport, right in the heart of Lamp District. Booked on Priceline $66.00 plus tax. Parking Saturday after 6pm. and Sunday free at town meters. Double Duece Best nightclub/bar. and the rooms were 3 - 3.5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: juanitaboles
Reviews.Content: I knew I had chosen a great hotel to see San Diego for the first time when the shuttle driver said I had the best location. Indeed it was, one block to the trolley, one block to the bus that takes you directly to the zoo, two blocks to Horton Mall, and being in the gas lamp district. But the real reason to stay here is the friendly staff that greets you as you come and go everytime you enter or exit the hotel. One of the clerks even noticed I had gotten my hair cut! I felt safe here as a solo traveler and will definitely be back. This is an historic building that took millions to renovate; the decor is wonderful, right down to the old post office collection box across from the elevators. I couldn't have chosen a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Third Time - Still a Charm!”
Reviews.Author: stevelieb
Reviews.Content: I travel much of the country, and simply love coming to San Diego if for no other inviting reason to stay at this hotel. This historic building is filled with "Old California" charm. The rooms, while smaller than modern construction (they were offices), are still comfortable and functional. The location adjacent to the Gaslamp District is perfect for a long walk after a long business day. When I tried to book the hotel through my corporate travel site, the hotel was unavailable. I called the Front Desk Manager (Brandon), who helped me with a reservation. When I checked in, the Corporate Sales Manager (Tiffany) contacted me and we met to discuss how she might work with my Corporate Travel Manager to maintain the hotel on the preferred list for future stays. I used the fitness center this trip and found it very nice with plenty of equipment. Another incredible stay, and wonderful support from a warm and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: desertfor123456
Reviews.Content: [stayed in late 2008] we booked another hotel around the corner, but that place was so noisy at night after one night we moved to the Courtyard & slept fine. great breakfast, with omelette bar

Reviews.Title: “For the Gas Lamp area nightlife couldn't better the location”
Reviews.Author: GaryCI
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times and I find it a great place to stay as not intrusive. Once checked in, unless you need assistance, there is no hinderance, you can even opt not to have daily regular cleaning for environmental reasons but also rewarding you with Marriott reward credits. The hotel although quite sizeable never appears busy and has an air of calm about it althoguh situated on the busiest road in town

Reviews.Title: “Would Never Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: MindyLePooh
Reviews.Content: I chose the Courtyard because I was intrigued by its listing on the National Registry of Historic Places. But apparently when the building was converted from a bank to a hotel, they didn't bother installing any additional sound proofing or insulation materials - which is completely insane considering that a House of Blues is located immediately next door! On a Saturday night (which is when I stayed), the noise and vibrations from whatever was going on in the venue was enough to wake the dead. The thumping went on until the wee hours of the night, and the next morning, a screaming toddler next door decided that nobody should sleep past 6:30am. On top of everything, the A/C unit in the room was loud, the plumbing was loud, the room was cramped, and the view out the window was pretty depressing (homeless people and tattoo parlors). The only good thing I can say about this place is that it is close to public transportation so you can get the hell out.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: Conner2dood
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel prior to a cruise. Friendly staff is very noticeable wherever you go in hotel. Building is historic site in old bank building. Lobby is particularly beautiful. Breakfast was excellent as was comfort of very large king-bed room. No pool and no balconies, but everything else is excellent. Yes, there is a large number of homeless people walking around the neighborhood, but they didnt bother me. Large shopping center and excellent restaurants in Gaslight quarter outside your door. It's about 10 blocks downhill or a $8.00 cabride to the port.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: YellowJacketFan91
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in November 2010. Had a 10th floor room facing the central shaft but that high up I didn't hear any noise and could still see out into the street. I thought everyone of the staff that I interacted with was exceptionally friendly - room service, house keeping, front desk, and the bar. They didn't put out a room service menu one day so the room service people contacted housekeeping and I got a personal note of apology for what is really a small thing. Everything was clean and tidy. The location is great - immediately adjacent to the Gaslamp Quarter and to the trolley.

Reviews.Title: “Nice historic hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: South_Pasadena_1
Reviews.Content: Converted bank building with interesting rooms in typical Courtyard setup. Very convenient to Amtrak with short ride on San Diego Trolley. Some rooms are much worse than others (particularly lower floors with views of interior air shaft and mechanicals). Nice on-site restaurant and bar in former bank lobby. No on-site parking and some street noise but both are OK. More of a business hotel than a place for shopping or kids.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Not the noise”
Reviews.Author: FLR
Reviews.Content: We were getting together for a birthday celebration and decided to stay in the Gaslamp district because you can walk or take metro to many locations. What I liked: Loved the look of the hotel, very cool. It was the Old San Diego Bank and Trust. The lobby still has the teller windows and beautiful decor. They have this large dated photo of how the bank looked originally and its fun to look around and see what has remained the same. The rooms are converted from the old offices. You're not sure if you are looking for your accountants office, which is also adds to the ambiance. The hotel had a GREAT happy hour we spent about 2 hours just visiting and enjoying the reasonably priced drinks. As mentioned earlier, it is central to lots of San Diego's tourist’s destinations (although we were not doing much sightseeing.) There are many, many nice restaurants in the area to chose from, all different price ranges. Hotel is also close to Petco. We wandered to the basement where they have converted the vault into a meeting room. Don't miss the old telephone booths...you remember telephone booths. What I didn't like: I was initially given a room on the third floor with absolutely no view. The window looked out at the hotel generator or some large piece of machinery. The hotel clerk was not the friendliest person but did change me to a room looking out at the bay. The room next door was filled with young adults that partied all night long. I think I should have stayed in the room with no view. And last but not least the hotel did not have a pool. All in all I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay - Great Experience in a historic building!”
Reviews.Author: stevelieb
Reviews.Content: I bragged about the "coolness" of this unique property that is part of a national chain. I even convinced our corporate travel manager to allow this property as company preferred. The building is a restored bank building from the 20's, so the rooms are naturally a bit smaller than many of us are accustomed to by today's standards, but are comfortable, the bed is great and the staff is wonderful! I travelled with a group of 6 colleagues and we arrived mid-afternoon prior to check-in. The staff took care of all of us and even upgraded me to a spa suite on the second floor. I did feel like Ron Burgundy in San Diego with my in-room hot-tub! The hotel is walking distance to the bars/restaurants of the Gas-Lamp district. Be sure to try "The Strip Club" for dinner. Breakfast at the hotel was solid, check out the old vault converted to a conference room downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great setting and service in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Skypondmtns
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night at the tail end of a business meeting in La Jolla. Great service, very clean, elegant decor (old bank building), helpful staff, Marriott quality plus, nice bed and bathroom. Good view of city from the 8th floor looking south towards bay. Very near Gaslamp Quarter with nice restaurants and nightlife, and Horton Plaza for shopping. Since I was solo, I caught public transit (nice and clean) right outside hotel to go to SD Zoo and to tour SD on Old Town Trolley (jumped on at Horton Plaza) and the next morning caught public transit right outside to go to the airport (only 10 minutes, no transfers, and less than $3). Friendly people and great weather and so many fun activities for whole family. Must return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great historic building, good location”
Reviews.Author: ATLSkinsfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. The historic building has been restored and was a bank, so the marble covered walls and teller stands are gorgeous. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms was very clean, but it was small -- guessing because it was formerly an office. Rooms on the back side have an awful view -- A/C units and the backside of another building. Overall it was a nice hotel and the location is good, a short walk to Horton Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location, Charming Old Building”
Reviews.Author: Lemiracle
Reviews.Content: My brother and I spent one night at the Courtyard after going to a Padres game. We were rushing from Anaheim (in fact, we went to an Angels game at 12:35pm and then hustled down the I-5 in time to make the Padres at 7:05pm) so we didn't get to the hotel until quite late. But we called that afternoon and they said a late check-in was no problem. The building, as others have written, really is quite interesting. It's an old bank, and they more or less left the ornate lobby unchanged -- ie, the front desk staff sits where the tellers would have been. Very cool. Also, the hallways on the guest floors look more like what you'd find in an office than a normal hotel. We enjoyed the vibe. The rooms themselves are fine. We had a decent view looking north, and while the hotel is in a busy area, there was no street noise. Standard double-beds, decent TV, fine bathroom, etc. Totally solid. The location is the major selling point. The hotel sits on the northen edge of San Diego's Gaslamp Quarter, which is absolutely loaded with lively bars and restaurants. Sure, some of the scene is a little fratboy-ish, but it's also fun and some of the side streers are very cool. The Courtyard doesn't sit right in the middle of it, like the standard Marriott, but it's also $100 or so cheaper. Seemed like a good trade-off to us. Good spot, good value, fun/funky vibe. We'd stay here again, certainly.

Reviews.Title: “worth the money savings”
Reviews.Author: Javisdad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Courtyard to save some money. I was attending a conference at the convention center and the conference hotels were up to double the cost of the Marriott. Since I was going to be in meetings all day, I decided to get some exercise and save some money. the hotel is an old bank, I forgot this until I walked it. Brought a smile to my face. The check in is at a teller stand. Hilarious. Being a bank means the rooms were solid and I heard no noise at night, but it also meant the internet didn't reach your room (but you could go to the lobby). The walk to the convention center was a hike, but it was fun going through the Gaslamp district. I felt safe and was amused by the all the partying going on (stayed thurs-sun). I would not bring my kids through this madhouse though. Service was functional but not outstanding. I could have stayed closer but the lovely weather made the long walk a pleasure. The hotel didn't have a lot of the stuff that the big hotels do, but if you want to save money, walk or take a taxi and have a nice room, then this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our 40th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: COCA28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four days at the Courtyard by Marriott with 21 members of our combined family. Our group included seniors, adults and four young children. Everyone loved the hotel's ambience, with the old bank building's beautiful restorations. Beds were super comfortable, the hotel provided special ADA services for our seniors, and the entire restaurant/bar area became our meeting place. We also enjoyed our banquet in a private room. Only complaint was my husband's concern that service at the banquet was not as available as he had hoped, but the rest of the hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Antigony
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the Memorial Day week-end. Had received an upgrade upon checking in because the city view rooms weren't available (and probably my Silver Elite status helped) so I can't speak for the regular rooms but the corner rooms (906 & 908) were excellent, very large bedroom and bathroom, magnificent views over downtown & to Coronado bridge. All very clean just as I am used to when staying at a Courtyard, even though this one was comparable to a Marriott! It's in a former landmark (bank) and very centrally located, only 5 minutes walk to the Gaslamp Quarter. The hot and cold breakfast buffet incl. egg station was excellent and good value for money! Parking was on the expensive side (valet $30/night) but we could have the car taken out of the garage as many times as we wanted to. We didn't want the stress of looking for parking every time but just drop off the key and forget about the car.

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoy our stay”
Reviews.Author: matthewianhall
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here multiple times and have enjoyed it every time. The staff are friendly and helpful. It is in a great location, and the building and rooms have great character.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Property, friendly staff, great location - expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: ocInvestor2
Reviews.Content: Housed in a rennovated bank building, this is one of the most architectually unique hotels I have ever stayed in. The location is right at the top of San Diego's Gaslamp Quarter and a great location to enjoy this area from. It is also a nice ten minute walk to the SD convention center. Staff is courteous and professional. Rooms are clean with above average appointments for a Courtyard property. The breakfast (not included in the room rate) is very good with cook to order omellettes and nice fresh fruit. The lobby also has a nice bar and there is a 7/11 next door if you need some munchies or a soda for your room. Higher floors are quiet, but on another stay with a room on the second floor, I heard alot of street noise (usually loud partiers from the nearby gaslamp walking past the hotel) The one huge bogie is the parking - a $30 valet charge (self is not an option). I suppose this is the perils of a downtown property, but it is the highest I have encountered in San Diego. All in all a fine property. Great for someone coming to enjoy the Gaslamp or attend a convention.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Jackkeyz
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel in a historic property that was formerly a bank. The place itself is a tourist attraction. I have no idea how they managed to convert a bank building into a hotel, but they did a superb job. The room was large, airy and well appointed. It is close to the Gaslamp Quarter and the harbor. But best of all was the customer service I received while I was there. Everyone was polite, friendly and helpful...to the nth degree.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible air quality in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: zhenkah
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located and is of interested to those who like to take pictures of old bank lobbies. But I would not recommend staying there if you hope to get a good night of sleep. The air in the rooms is stuffy, and the rooms have no vents for outside air to come in. The air conditioning system works poorly, and in any case, all it does is recirculate the air in the room. So if your room reeks of air-freshening chemicals (which mask other odors) upon your arrival, there is no way to air it our.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Vibe!”
Reviews.Author: Kayla_Savu
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have chosen a better hotel to stay at for my vacation in San Diego! It was walking distance from everything and the architecture itself blew me away! I love high ceilings and dramatic chandeliers. The rooms are very "home-y" and the bed, well let's just say I was prepared to spend the entire weekend just watching TV cuddled up in bed. The hotel staff is very friendly and accomodating, they were able to answer all my questions and room services was quick and precise! I would recomment this hotel to anyone going to San Diego, whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Gaslamp Quarter not for Children”
Reviews.Author: Stroller_Snob
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews about the Gaslamp Quarter and how it is not 'kid friendly' -they were not kidding. We decided to stay at the SD Courtyard anyways. Be preapred to pay $30 for valet parking -you don't have to, but good luck hunting down a parking spot somewhere close on the streets. The Courtyard is housed in an old bank built in 1928, which is pretty cool. They have kept the lobby in the original architechture with the brass teller windows and orginal marble, which I thought was pretty cool. The hotel was SOLID! We were on the 10th floor and could not hear the people in the surrounding rooms -not even the shower or toilet. We had tons of natural light, which was quite nice. The hallways & room doors are all original, which adds to the uniqueness of the hotel. I really liked the staff as they were helpful and accommodating in the needs of our children, which were the only ones staying there. My husband did venture out after dark, which is when the single scene starts. From what my husband told me it was pretty ritzy -velvet ropes and all that jazz. From what I saw from my 10th floor window -I wish I discovered the gaslamp district night scene when I was single. Comfy beds, lots of natural light, spacious rooms, helpful staff, fast valet, great location, quiet & solid rooms, no swimming pool, and expensive parking fee/valet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant accomodations, friendly staff, very clean, great breakfast buffet!”
Reviews.Author: jhama
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay here again! Very equivalent to any 5 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: idaho1900
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Downtown Courtyard by Marriott was great! The front desk staff was friendly and the valet parking attendants were extremely helpful. The location was convenient because of all the restaurants so close by. Went to a Easter Sunday concert brunch at the House of Blues right next door that was fantastic. We never felt afraid to be out at night because there were so many other people out enjoying the nightlife. Really liked the elegant feel of the old building.

Reviews.Title: “Location, history, elegance.”
Reviews.Author: bartdenver
Reviews.Content: The location is great and close to the Gaslight District. Tons of restaurants and clubs within walking distance. The hotel is beautiful in a former bank building. The lobby and other common areas are quite lovely. On the lower level is an area that incorporates the old safe door....very impressive. The room was very nice but a bit lacking in that their was not a fridge and the windows are not operable. Some fresh air would have been nice. The views were great! The heater/air was rather noisy. The valet parking was very convenient and the staff was quite friendly and helpful. We happened on Easter Gospel Brunch at the House of Blues which was fabulous and located next door to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: OCRosie
Reviews.Content: The staff was awesome! We were greeted with excellent customer service from the minute we pulled up to the hotel. Our stay was short but very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “very central location, nice breakfast, but some negative points...”
Reviews.Author: Radiolina
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 7 nights, booked it as recommended through conference website. Location is very central, 5th avenue with loads of restaurants and shops is 5 min walk away. The area does feel somewhat unsafe at night though...there are many homeless people around as other reviews said. Must say it's the case in many streets of the gaslamp quarter though. Breakfast was really nice, you get many choices, omelettes done on the moment in front of you with what you want, various cold + warm options and fresh fruit. The room was spacious with an extremely confortable king size bed, the bathroom ok. Big problem to me: you can not open the windows! Not even a tiny bit to let fresh air come in, and the room smelled like it had been closed for ages. The smell had transfered to the bed linen and towels too. Moreover my room had a horrible view on an tiny backyard...really not worth looking through the window. Don't know if it's worth asking for a city view though, because broadway has quite a lot going on at night and it might get noisy. It also got noisy on the Saturday night when I woke up due to a couple of girls screaming either in the next room or corridor :-( Fortunately someone else was quicker than me and told them to be quiet and it stopped. Overall I think the hotel is a good option for business in town, the convention center isn't really that close (20 min walk), but you'll be close to the restaurants. Honestly the window part was the most disturbing, as it also prevented the smell to leave...But well, hearing from the rest of the hotels and taking into account the prices I would recommend it. Staff was friendly and the building is really nice

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Conversion, you gotta see it!”
Reviews.Author: jeffbond005
Reviews.Content: This hotel resides in a former Savings and Loan, and was renovated while still incorporating some of the bank's elements. The lobby still has the marble teller windows and below the lobby there is a conference room with a GIANT safe door and the inside is lined with safe deposit boxes! Even if you don't stay here, you got to check out this stuff, it is way cool. We stayed here to see a show at the House of Blues, which is perfect because the entrance is literally the next door up the street. It is right close to a trolley stop, so it is super convenient to explore the rest of the city. The hotel has a 1920's feel to it, very classic, but still with all the amenities you expect in a modern hotel. This place is worth a stay, check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: widivegirl
Reviews.Content: We took a short 4 day vacation to San Diego and stayed at the Courtyard. Initially, we were a little nervous to stay downtown with having a 6 month old with us, but the staff and location were great. Our room was very spacious and comfortable with great views of the city. We used the valet parking at the hotel. We didn't think it was too much more than the other parking areas nearby. From the moment we checked in the staff was very friendly, helpful and accommodating. The location is just a block off of the Gaslamp District. We loved being able to walk to dinner and shopping. Dinner at the Blue Point Coastal Cuisine was fantastic. They allowed us to bring our stroller into the restaurant, so our baby could sleep while we ate. We also ventured away from the hotel to checkout La Jolla, visit the San Diego Wild Animal Park, visit Point Loma and take a trolley tour. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with substandard staff in a scary area”
Reviews.Author: Katrinakaren
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazingly beautiful and that is where the advantages stop. it was terrifying to walk around the area at night and the staff were very rude. They do not offer hideaway beds so your kids will sleep on the floor. The rooms are super tiny and unlike most every hotel in california they don't have a pool. Why go to kali if you can't enjoy the sunshine. Homeless people patrol the streets which surround the hotel and accost the random passerby, And there is no view, don't let them tell you otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning View From the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: rameyandgayathri
Reviews.Content: If you plan on a downtown San Diego visit, you must stay at this Marriott. The views (facing the water) are truly awesome with a bridge in the background and numerous warships within view (San Diego is a base for some US Navy operations). The higher floor you stay on (esp. the suites) the more glorious your views, both of the water and of the swimming pool below. It provides a tropical feel even in mid-winter. The hotel itself has many amenities for work and play. From tennis (where several local players avail themselves of the facilities) to the gym, the choices are diverse. This was one of the best Marriott's I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Building, OK Room”
Reviews.Author: graciegirl1
Reviews.Content: The building is great, the staff was great but the room was just OK...also paying $30 to park overnight--even when your car can be taken in and out as many times as you wish--is a lot to pay at a Courtyard. I think our greatest disappointment was the room and we were even upgraded to suite since our room wasn't ready. The furniture was older as was the decor. The towels were very nice! Coffee in the lobby at 7 am was very nice, too. As I said, the hotel itself was great but the room/suite we were in was just old and tired and dark. Maybe we just got an older outdated room. But for us, the decor and the room is very importnat. Again, the staff was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “1920's luxury and refinement in an efficient and beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Songbird4JC
Reviews.Content: The building the Courtyard Marriott in downtown San Diego was originally built to be a very stately and elegant bank, which opened in 1928. As I love to notice even small spots of beauty in even the roughest architecture whenever I travel, you can imagine what a feast for my eyes were all the carved marble, intricately decorated solid brass elevator doors, the columns in the grandiose lobby, even the original teller stations were preserved for Front Desk check-in! Sometimes a beautiful setting can be ruined by poor service, or one employee's bad attitude or lack of tact. But this Courtyard, at least in December of 2009, employs outstanding and cheerful workers who are efficient and carry themselves with poise that matches the glorious building. We were given one of the suites with a jacuzzi tub right in the room. Fabulous. Even the mattress was a tad more comfy than most Marriott beds. One problem was the huge bathroom door which opened up with its entire face directly against the nightstand of the bed. The problem was that the door jutted out further than the table. So, I was concerned with getting bruised at night if I got up in the dark. If you're not willing to search the neighborhood for street parking, you will have to pay $24 for valet parking service per night. One rainy December evening after rounding the neighborhood a few times, we did just that. On our checkout morning, I glanced at the floor by the door for the receipt, which is often slipped under it. But I guess that because the entire building is so solidly and exactly built, that slipping the bill under the door is not possible! As expected, it is the quietest hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!! Exceptional experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Adriellie
Reviews.Content: I always use Trip Advisor for planning our trips, but this is only the second time that I've taken the time to write a review. Our experience was so wonderful that I wanted to recommend this hotel to other travelers. If I could give this hotel more than 5 circles, I would! We stayed at this hotel for four nights in January (prior to going on a cruise out of San Diego), and it was to celebrate a very special occasion, so we spent a lot of time reading all of the hotel reviews for the Gaslamp District since we wanted to be sure that it was truly special by choosing the 'right' hotel. After being intrigued by this hotel and the unique bank decor that others wrote about, I called the hotel to ask a few questions. I spoke with Brandon, who was so exceptionally friendly, helpful, and accomodating, that I knew that this was where we would stay. The staff at check-in was exceptionally friendly (and remained so during our entire stay)...a special thank you to Rayna who was so efficient and friendly! The hotel is beautiful and unique with the original 1920's look and feel, and beautifully maintained. Our room was so clean, comfortable, and quiet, and we had a wonderful view of the city and water. The location was perfect....in the Gaslamp District, close to the bus and trolley lines. We didn't have a vehicle, but the public transportation is great and inexpensive. Needless to say, the next time we travel to San Diego, we would stay here again! We loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place and Super Value!!”
Reviews.Author: jenmies9
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this Marriott. The building is really cool, (you feel like you're in an old movie when you walk in) the service was great (really nice front desk staff), the breakfast buffett (albeit a bit pricey) was delicious, and the location was great. And all for an advanced purchase rate of $89 per night. Unbelieveable! I highly recommend scheduling a private dinner downstairs in the old bank vault, converted into a conference room. Very cool. I'd stay here again for sure! This place changed my perception of a Courtyard Marriott forever!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Old bank building turned hotel....very cool”
Reviews.Author: Austinmike28
Reviews.Content: This is a really neat hotel. We stayed here one night on a week long road trip. The building use to be an old bank. When the bank closed they renovated they place and turned it into a hotel. However, they kept the old time teller windows up, along with the vaults and safe deposit rooms, and it really is pretty cool to see all of it. The lobby of the hotel is very nice and open with a huge decorated ceiling. Our room was very cozy, and had two very comfy queen beds, although the bathroom was a little small...it wasn't a big deal though. The location of this hotel is great, because you are one block from the gaslamp area of town and two or three blocks from the rail line. I had a great time here and would advise everyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The most unique Courtyard we've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaBill
Reviews.Content: Booked this Courtyard for a holiday vacation. Beautiful 1920's building with original details. Fantastic staff who was consistently friendly and accomodating. Location right in the Gaslamp District, near dozens of restaurants and bars. Having compared this hotel to several others (and finally choosing it based on price), I wouldn't stay anywhere else when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access from airport, close to Gaslamp, nice lobby”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: As many reviewers have stated, this is a converted-from-a-bank hotel with an impressive looking lobby. The rooms are OK, nothing fantastic but right in line with what you expect from an urban Courtyard hotel. It is very easy getting here from the airport. Walk out of the terminal and hop on Bus 992. It will take youinto downtown SD in a few minutes. The bus leaves every 15 minutes. Its final stop is Horton Plaza on Broadway and 4th. The CY is less than 2 short blocks away. Horton Plaza is the last stop so it's impossible to get lost. San Diego has a large population of homeless, many of whom have take up residence near this area. That being said, they are not especially aggressive (at least not that I observed). Parking is $24 a day, which is high but it is very easy to get around the city without a car. Multiple buses run up and down Broadway and the orange and blue tram lines are a block away. You can buy a multiple day pass ahead of time through the transit.511sd.com site ($15 for a 4-day pass in dec 209).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old building, very unique”
Reviews.Author: Deb L
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful except for one thing. The water temperature in the shower varied a great deal. It was either cold or scalding. I believe a child could get scalded because it changed so fast. Other than that, I can find no fault with this hotel. The location is great. There is a buffet breakfast or you can order from the menu. The staff was great. The beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quick downtown getaway”
Reviews.Author: kbear50
Reviews.Content: Not what we expected for a Couryard but was surprised by the beautiful old bank building, clean rooms, nice beds, fluffy towels, great view. Surrounded by lots of shopping and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Cool at Marriott Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: JaniceWa
Reviews.Content: This Marriott (530 Broadway in San Diego) used to be a bank that was built in the 1920s. They have kept many of the orginal features--vault doors, tellar's cages, fantastic ceilings. It was so QUIET, which we loved. It felt like you were going back in time, yet with modern amenities. We got great service and wonderful drinks at the bar from a fantastically friendly bar tender with a waxed moustache. The whole experience was great and he really helped put it together.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aem2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for shopping, dining, entertainment etc. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. They provided excellent directions and recommendations for restaurants and entertainment, and gave me a free upgrade to a room with fantastic views of the stadium and water. Hotel is a little old, but very clean. Building used to be a bank, and the hotel utilizes the old vault for business conference rooms. I would stay here again for my next trip to downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Asia_Bound_Hippie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 1 October to 4 October. The interior of the hotel is absolutely gorgeous! It exceeded my expectations for a Courtyard by Marriot. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. They always smiled and really made it seem as if it was a pleasure to help you. I appreciate that. The rooms are very nice! Housekeeping does a great job and they are quick to respond to any requests you have. My only issue was that the telephone in my room did not work but other than that, it was great! It is located near the trolleys and the Gaslamp Quarter which made for easy entertaining. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Courtyard by Marriott in Downtown, you won't need to travel anywhere”
Reviews.Author: SRover
Reviews.Content: Courtyard is located in the heart of San Diego. The minute you step out, you're on the one street in San Diego which is filled with the best restaurants in town. The rooms are spacious, the bed is the most comfortable bed ever, has white bedsheets! Bathroom is spacious, they provide toothbrushes, toothpaste, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, there's a coffee maker, A KING SIZED TV!! The only disadvantage is the breakfast. You might expect them to serve a lavish breakfast at this price, but the breakfast consists of fruits, danishes, and Seattle's Best coffee/tea/juices (no milk)

Reviews.Title: “Rock N' Roll Marathon”
Reviews.Author: strouder31
Reviews.Content: I backed up country rock artist Kate Russell on the New Balance stage for the Big Rock N' Roll Marathon in San Diego. I was only there 2 days so I didn't get to see alot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tojo72
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here,the hotel was very elegant,the staff was polite and helpful,and the hotel was very central to a lot of things.many were in walking distance and 10 minute rides to the zoo,airport,and seaworld.For me the noise wasn't a problem,meaning that there was none,we were on th 11th floor and heard nothing in the halls,adjacent rooms,or from the streets,not a sound.Only thing valet parking was high but tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Location after Dark”
Reviews.Author: onthetown1
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to see the fantastic reviews of this Marriott since I had a totally different experience in my recent business stay in San Diego. The location of this Courtyard is not what I would recommend for families, or any other travelers unless you are specifically going for nightlife. My business associates and I were approached by a group of men demanding money on the street not even one block from the hotel around 11:00 p.m. We refused but there was a scene. I would not want my family to encounter this on a trip to San Diego. The rooms were little and the bathroom even smaller. The staff made an effort to enjoy themselves and acted friendly but they were not able to respond to simple requests at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual Courtyard but totally up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: DX-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Unusual building, but totally Marriott, i.e. clean and well run. Corner room had great views. King size bed, large TV with plenty of HD channels, good desk for working. Good lighting and good ceiling height. Bathroom of medium size and clean; lots of soft fluffy towels. A small coffee maker stocked daily with supplies. AC working well. It's on a sensor so when you leave, it turns off. Upon return, the AC kicks in immediately and cools the room quickly, in particular if you keep the blinds drawn in your absence. Wired internet in room and WiFi in lobby are free and quite speedy. The hot water is very hot. Staff friendly and helpful. Location within easy walking distance for restaurants, shopping, conferences etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Terrific historic building.”
Reviews.Author: PTSOA12
Reviews.Content: The pluses definitely outway the minuses with this hotel: On the plus side: Great location within walking distance of Gaslamp Quarter (what a blast!!) Centrally located with easy access to nearby beaches and other attractions Terrific building with great architecture. (check out the ceiling/columns in the main lobby and the "vault" meeting room in the basement for starters) Courteous and helpful staff. Nice, clean room, even if a bit on the small side Nice workout facility Normally I would put $24 per night parking on the "minus" ledger. However, after experiencing the "cluster #*%@" that is downtown San Diego parking, it was well worth the expense. On the minus side Our room had a lovely view of the side of a building Air conditioning system was very noisy kicking on and off. If you are a light sleeper, beware The neighboring club was noisy until early in the morning Extended neighborhood had numerious vagrants (I never felt felt uneasy about going out and about and never had any issues) No pool (historical landmark so this is not a possibility)

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous Location and Smelly Rooms”
Reviews.Author: AlexNyNy
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay for several nights and checked out in a hurry after being swarmed on by aggressive beggars immediately outside the hotel. We booked what was called a suite and it turned out to be two rooms facing a construction site. The windows are permanently sealed. The room smelled like many years of stale odors and it was hard to even breathe. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone with a choice. The location, although close to nightlife, is startling for anyone who is sober. The area is filled with beggars and drug addicts who are laying in the gutters in great numbers. We stayed at this hotel several years ago and the area has taken a severe downturn. Beware. We checked out as soon as we could but it was a complete waste of time and money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: mrz326
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Courtyard a few times now. It is in an old restored bank building and it is fabulous. The top floors have the best views and they are also bigger rooms. The service is fantastic and the employees are great. It is walking distance to the gaslamp. The only drawback is the lack of parking, but I guess that is a downtown hotel for you. I would recommend this hotel, it is great...

Reviews.Title: “beautiful old architecture”
Reviews.Author: JP_Phx
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on Priceline for $79 on Fri. and Sat. nights. Beautiful old bank building with amazing architecture from 1928. Charm abounds. Room is moderate, it looks like they tried to make furnishings to match the building, but in turn it just looks dated. Spacious, adequate room, we chose to have quiet instead of street views, and the location was convenient to the Gaslamp District. a 10 minute walk to Petco Park, Convention Center or Horton Plaza. $24 parking seemed high but worth it - call down and your car is waiting for you, free internet access and nice business center adjacent to the free coffee and newspapers in the lobby. Breakfast in the cafe was well worth it - Belgian waffle with strawberries and bacon was delicious. Go to Heavenly Cupcakes down 6th St. Hotel was a good value for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!! Alright hotel”
Reviews.Author: janellb
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again just because of the location. It's right on the outside of the lamp-district downtown--right next to the ball park. The restaurant/bar downstairs is great. It's right next to the metro too. However, the rooms were alright. Nothing bad really to say about them but nothing really stood out as great either. Parking is outrageous!!! But there's a pretty cheap parking garage right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very unique Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Wheels48
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 4 nights the middle of June. The people were friendly & courteous.The lobby of this hotel is really beautiful. Our room was a good size but there was no view, which was ok with us. Beds were very comfortable. The location is walking distance to many restaurants & sights. It was a short walk to Petco Park. Across the street you could pick up the bus to the Zoo(which was super). There are alot of restaurants in Gaslamp but one we really loved was Asti. Delicious food & a wonderful waiter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, terrible parking situation”
Reviews.Author: TheCrabbyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice location. There is so much with in walking distance of this hotel. The hotel is an old bank building and the architecture and decor is very interesting. The room I was in was a little small and didn't have much of a view, but it was clean and they had free Internet in the rooms. The downside to this place is the valet parking. The rates were highway robbery, and the valet service was a joke!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting looking hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fortwood
Reviews.Content: This is a good mid-range hotel for business travelers. Internet connection was free, and the breakfast is priced reasonably. There is a very efficiently organized fitness center in the basement with several treadmills. While you are in the basement, be sure to check-out the displays of the vaults. I've stayed at Courtyard brand at many locations, but this one by far is very unique as it used to be a bank building. The room is a bit smaller than a regular courtyard hotel room, but more than plenty for a business traveler. My room was not facing the street, and I didn't hear any noise.

Reviews.Title: “Valet?!?”
Reviews.Author: fo1mock3
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous and historic hotel - small but good-looking rooms. Great, open lobby. Decent staff. Rowdy valet. Limited wifi. Husband - then boyfriend, got a new motion sensing recorder for his birthday and we happened to have it in the car during our drive from Pasadena to San Diego. We later noticed the recording picked up the valet pumping up the music in the car. Lots of burning rubber. Talking to self or someone else? Two days later, before we left the hotel on a day trip to the charming mountain town of Julien husband noticed one of the car's tires needed air, which was odd since the tires were 3-months old. After putting air in the tire we sped along the freeway in the fast lane when the tire popped. Luckily husband knew how to stop a car out of control and there wasn't a good deal of traffic on the freeway. We got the idea that our safety was compromised by the hotel valet. There is no way to be convinced, however. Definately made an impression on us.

Reviews.Title: “Very good mid-range option”
Reviews.Author: SFGDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good, I stayed on the 14th floor and had a greta view although some views ar over reatail and parking spaces. It's about 12mins walk from the conference centre and the airport bus stops just a block to the west along Broadway. The staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. The House of Blues and the Local are good nearby watering holes. The nearby night-spots can be noisy between 10pm and about 1am even from the 14th floor. The room was big and well appointed with a large television and all the usual sports channels etc. The bathroom was also well presented and in very good condition. The room comes with wireless internet access at no extra cost. There is an iron and ironing board too but no safe in the room. An ice-machine and drinks vending machine can be found on every floor.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2202
Reviews.Content: Building was an old bank so the converted lobby is absolutely huge and beautiful! The cookies at reception were delicious- I couldn't keep my boyfriend away from them. The rooms are clean and classy... no complaints at all. We were in town for the Padres game and had convenient access to a fun night on the town! Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: froggyUK
Reviews.Content: Only here fro 1 night but what a pleasant place. Very friendly check in - fast too. The room was just right, clean and well maintained. Very quiet in the hotel. Right in the heart of downtown just steps away from the Gaslight Quarter and just over the road form the Horton Plaza. Nice to see the old bank features retained.

Reviews.Title: “Distinctive Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: MajorMarket
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel for the Labor Day holiday weekend a few weeks back. Secured it through Priceline ($89/night for 3 nights) and was very pleasantly surprised. From the moment the valet supervisor (Stephen) greeted me to the front desk staff, they were all warm, welcoming, and professional. I have to commend them for their hospitality and upbeat energy. This CBM is not like others in the chain. It was a former bank and many of the architectual details have been woven into the hotel. The front desk uses some of the old marble teller windows and the hotel restaurant uses the high arched lobby as its setting. The vintage oak doors to the bank offices have been retained for use as the hotel room doors - definitely a nice distinctive touch. The elevators have classic brass doors, too. One little detail: from the reception desk to the elevators, there is a small staircase of 4-5 stairs. No way around it and it makes for an odd bit of ergonomics. Too many to fling your bag down but too few to stow the rolling wheel feature to carry. Being at the edge of the Gaslamp Quarter provides a good buffer from the noise of the nightclubs yet allows easy access to the nightlife. Valet parking is the only option - at $24 per day, it is not the cheapest but you have unlimited in-and-out privileges. Give the guys about a 15 minute lead to fetch your car and you'll be fine. They do really hustle to get the cars brought up - I've seen them run.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Rokit
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic stay. We are a family of 4 (kids aged 4 & 8) and stayed 7 nights at the Courtyard by Marriott San Diego Downtown. All staff (especially the front desk) were extremely courteous and assisted planning our days. Nothing was a problem for them. The information provided was spot on. The room was beyond our expectations in size and comfort level. The hotel is located close to transport and all amenities. We wish we could stay there more often.

Reviews.Title: “Service just superb - even for a Marriott - and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: johnnydogmatic
Reviews.Content: I favor Marriotts for the quality of service but this one topped them all. Concierge, valet, dining and bar staff just wonderful. And what a location! The lobby is so majestic too.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Service, Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: koskillin
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, excellent service, valet on time, Gaslamp Quarter walking distance, Zoo 5-minute drive. Visited with spouse and 16-month old! Felt very welcome. We were given a very spacious room with view of PETCO park, bridge to Coronado Island and other San Diego Skyline gems. Stayed only a couple of nights on a weekend and although our room was next to elevator and a bit loud we still had a good night sleep. Pillows and bed were very comfortable. Toddler enjoyed every square inch of space and slept like a baby! A couple of negatives: As mentioned, the loudness near elevators enhanced by loud people and the water was extremely hot one morning and could not be adjusted for minutes.

Reviews.Title: “typical courtyard but in an historic building”
Reviews.Author: emm_diveintotheworld
Reviews.Content: we had no problems during our stay except that the parking is $24 per day! not a lot of nearby street parking so you have to pay. typical downtown situation. great location but parking .... the building is cool, rooms and hotel newly renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: migajon23
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel thru priceline for travel from Aug.30th to Sep. 2nd. Checkin was very fast and front desk was very helpful and friendly( I think her name was Rayna). Valet was very nice and took only a couple minutes to get bring the car up. Room was nice. Simple but had everything you needed. Location is great. Right in Gaslamp District, which is were all the bars, clubs and restaurants are located. Walked 5 blocks to Petco Park from hotel. Overall very nice hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Fanbabe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel with another couple in July. We cannot say enough nice things about this hotel. The rooms were great with alot of charm. The staff was fantastic and always friendly. We would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good spot in the Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: MarylinKK
Reviews.Content: Great architecture for a hotel, and it does look like a former bank still; great marble and woodwork. Staff was great - they gave me a room with a view of the harbor. Large king room with good internet access. Bose radios in the rooms. I didn't use the restaurant but there is one and the bar looked pretty active at night. Great location just off Gaslamp district, close to a city bus stop and to the Old Towne Trolley stop at Horton Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and marvelous staff!!”
Reviews.Author: warriorwoman531
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at this hotel for the past few years while attending San Diego Comic Con and we have never been disappointed. It is located on the edge of the Gaslamp District, with access to plenty of eating places and entertainment. It is also a short walk to the convention center. What we have always appreciated is the friendly and helpful staff. I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service & historic architecture”
Reviews.Author: TEW49ers
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this downtown high-rise Courtyard, near San Diego's Gaslamp district and Horton Plaza shopping. The hotel is a well-preserved bank built in 1928. Like other reviewers have said, the Reception counter and other parts of the lobby are made up of old marble Teller windows. One must go down to the "Safe Deposit" level and peek into the vault conference room - very cool! Guest rooms are old converted offices with old mail slots, and now have large bathrooms. Our 11th floor room facing the back was very quiet and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and recommended a nearby hair salon when I asked. You can walk to many places, including tasty (tho pricey) breakfast at the elegant US Grant Hotel. My husband and I go to San Diego 1-2x's/year, and would like to return to this Courtyard. It was also a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Belasaria
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard is a coverted bank building, so it does retain some of the bank charm with the reception desk very teller-esque. I stayed at the hotel on business for two nights. I arrived around noon and there were no rooms ready. However, the front desk clerk asked if I had had lunch yet and when I said no, she began suggesting a few that were close to the hotel. I checked my bags and headed off for lunch at the Yard House. The Courtyard is located in the Gaslamp District and you are within walking distance of an outdoor mall with lots of retailers. It's about 8 long blocks from the convention center ($10 taxi fare) and about 15 minutes from the airport ($15-20 taxi fare, depending on traffic). The room I was given faced interior, so I had a view of the office building next door and the construction. At first I was concerned that the construction noise would be too loud, but it was quiet during my stay. The bed was clean and comfortable and the work area a decent size. There were a sufficient number of outlets for my laptop, blackberry and iPod to be plugged in without having to move furniture. The bathroom was clean and larger than I expected. The hotel offers room service (which I didn't order) and does offers breakfast and dinner in the main lobby/bar area. I had drinks and dinner at the bar and the bartender was engaging and efficient. The bell staff was helpful. They have to be given that you have take a short flight of stairs down to the elevator. For those with early morning flights (mine was at 6 a.m.), be sure to book your cab the night before. When I'm in San Diego again, I'll definitely consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SillySallyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay here based on the location, we were very happy with our decision! This hotel was awesome, loved how it is sooo full of historic value! The staff is very friendly and accomadating.....Free computer access in the lobby was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Very different from your normal hotel”
Reviews.Author: TaliaT
Reviews.Content: When i arrived, and walked in, I knew that prior to arriving I would expect to see a renovated bank. Thats exactly what I got. BUT i love the uniqueness of it. I appreciate the work of a company that takes the time to renovate but not remove all the original aspects of the building. The service was excellent. If you valet your car, make sure to call ahead. It can take about 15 minutes to get your car since they park offsite. Also be prepared that there is no pool...so this may not be the best place for a week long vacation. The beds were really comfortable. From what I understand most of the rooms are different sized considering they are old renovated offices. You just have to know what to expect when walking into a place like this, and certainly not to expect the Ritz Carlton, but for the price and location, its a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Midwestern hospitality in a Western City”
Reviews.Author: uv124
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Marriott for 3 nights. My wife had a conference in San Diego Convention center and she booked the hotel through her conference website. We did not have much expectation from this provided our past experience with another Marriott (at Biscayne Bay, Miami). We arrived a little earlier than normal check-in time (around 2 pm) but the lady at the front desk let us check in without any question. She also later helped us redeem a Marriott Gift card (for some reason it was not activated by the issuer). The room was clean, large and nice with free internet and TV. Our remote was not working but one phone call was enough to get it replaced. We didn't order any room service, but the maid-service was excellent. They took extra care to make stuffs organized. The parking option in Gaslamp Quarters was limited so we had to go with valet parking (a whopping $24/day). The hotel itself didn't have any parking lot, my guess is they park the cars a few blocks north of the hotel. Anyhow, the price will seem reasonable once you stay in that area. Most hotels charge similar. As others have already mentioned, even if you're not staying in this hotel, just peek inside to see its interior decoration in the lobby. You won't be disappointed. The hotel was originally a bank and they have kept the original tellers and original roof intact. The hotel is conveniently located near many restaurants (some of them are best in San Diego), trolley station ( one block north at 5th Ave) and convention center (20 minutes stroll due South). We were tired on the day we arrived and decided to eat at the restaurant at the lobby. To our surprise the food was really good (or it could be that we were really hungry :)). The price was very reasonable, although the service was a little slow. The breakfast was not as good and you can have better breakfast elsewhere. I felt this was the only shortcomings of this hotel. However, there are so many good restaurant nearby one might not want to stay inside the hotel for long. I suspect this was the only reason they don't advertise their food so much. One reviewer mentioned about safety issues near the hotel. We did not have any problem during our stay. The area is well lit and we walked in and out of the hotel late at night without any fear. So if you don't want to book a car, that's absolutely fine. The MTS and trolley systems are pretty good in San Diego. Yes, there is an adult store just one block south of the hotel, and yes 6th street has less buzz than the 5th but its not scary at all! There are many restaurants in the nearby area but I will just mention a few very close to the hotel. For breakfast try Sixth Avenue Bistro. They make the best French Toast in my opinion. It is located just two block north of the hotel and right next to it there is Mama Gucci, which is voted the best Italian restaurant for lunch. A few block south on 6th avenue there is Chopahn, an Afghan restaurant, known for its kabobs. In general you'll be very happy with the City of San Diego itself, the hotel is just a part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise...”
Reviews.Author: Southern_girl012
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed when I walked into the Courtyard was the architecture of the building. The hotel is housed in an old, multi-million dollar restored, bank. The details are amazing. The second thing I noticed was the very attentive, very polite, and very helpful staff. Located within walking distance of the Gas Lamp district, restaurants, House of Blues, and several shops.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool place, great location!”
Reviews.Author: dbsanders
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting great things, just your average Courtyard. To my surprise, this hotel is actually a renovated bank building, so this was something new. Nice location, at the North end of the gaslamp, just close enough to the action. Don't forget to go downstairs and see the vault!

Reviews.Title: “OMG.. R U serious???”
Reviews.Author: GossipGirl
Reviews.Content: What brought this hotel to my attention was the fact that it is literally next door to House of Blues. I went on Orbitz, Expedia, and Priceline and the average price was $379 this was high in my eyes but I figured I would venture away from the Starwood hotels that I normally stay in when I’m in SD, so I called the hotel and tried to work out a lower price. Eventually I did.. I was able to get the room for under $200 and thought I was getting a STEAL for a SUPER luxuries hotel. Well.. I was wrong. As soon as we arrived at the hotel we walked over to HOB to ask the security guards how early we needed to be in line the following day so that we could get front row seats to our concert.. while talking to him we ran into some fans of the band that were spending the night in line to ensure they would get front row seats.. we overheard a conversation where the police were telling the crowds that the street behind them was the MOST DANGEROUS street in San Diego and that it WASN’T safe for them to be out there overnight. We started looking around and noticed that there were prostitutes and druggies all around.. that area by the trolley is VERY bad at night and not so great even during the day. Apart from the surrounding areas I was also very unpleased with the hotel itself. The lobby area is nice and the fact that it use to be a bank is interesting but the rooms are AWFUL… I have never been in a Motel 6 but I assume that the furniture would be similar to what we found in our room. We had what was supposed to be two Queen beds but in reality they were 2 twin and a half beds.. 2 adults could fit snugly in them but not very comfortably and they were as hard as a rock.. I was REALLY missing the comforts of the “heavenly beds” that the Starwood hotels provide. When we checked in we tried to confirm the 3pm check out that was promised to us over the phone but a not so nice women informed us that she could not guarantee the late check out until the next day and that we would have to call in the morning… but on a positive note we only had rudeness on arrival.. during the remainder of our stay the rest of the staff was cordial. Valet is $25 which is average for the area, if for some reason you decide to stay here PAY IT.. you don’t want to be walking around this hotel as a lost tourist. If you are young and looking to party I would recommend either The W or The Ivy.. if you are looking for a nice clean comfortable room in a GOOD area near Gaslamp and all other SD attractions I would definitely go with The Westin at Horton Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: steph92586
Reviews.Content: Spent Saturday night, October 13th, at the Courtyard Marriott in downtown San Diego, at the corner of Broadway and 6th, at the edge of the Gaslamp. Perfect location for shopping, dining, and sighseeing within walking distance. Rooms were large and nicely furnished, including the wonderful Marriott Mattresses on the beds. I am handicapped and need an accessible room, which had a nice shower, roll-in, with a bench and two shower heads. Right next door is the House of Blues for good food and good music. Can't wait to return! We were there on a family getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel right in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: tempejim
Reviews.Content: I've always had a wonderful time staying at this hotel. It is in an old bank building which makes for some interesting room shapes. The rooms are very clean and up to date. The staff is excellent and was always willing to go the extra mile to help. The location of the hotel is near/in the Gas Lamp so there is plenty of things to do at night. I stayed here this time for a conference at the convention center down the street. It was about a 10 minute walk to the convention center, but I didn't mind at all. Keep in mind that there is no self parking so you'll have to valet if you want to put the car at the hotel. My choice to stay in Downtown San Diego every time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location. Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: surfergirlsc
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of it's location. We were going to a concert at the House of Blues. This hotel is pretty much next door to the HOB. I really had no idea what to expect. It was a last minute thing, so I didn't spend the usual time reading the reviews. Everything went fine upon arrival. Parked right in front of hotel, valet was there, and so was a bell hop to take our luggage. Check in was quick and effortless. We were taken right to our room. Just had a basic room, with a AAA discount $189.00. We asked for the lowest floor possible and were put on the second floor. We didn't make any view requests. We had a view of the street and a few of the buildings across the way. The room was clean (and I'm really creeped out by cheap rooms, cheap bedding etc.) It was nice, bed was very comfortable, pillows and bedding were fine. Bathroom was clean, shower area was clean .....room was very comfortable. Also, the gym/workout room is very spacious, well equipped,,,,a definite plus As many people have mentioned, this is a great building. It was a bank in 1898 ( in that time frame) really nicely redone and preserved. Great atmosphere in the lobby, and tons of interesting features to look at, like the bank vault, the beautiful wood in the elevators, walls, everywhere. Really a nice experience just to be there. . As far as the area being "seedy", well, I agree with a previous reviewer.....you are in a big city. It's a typical big city. There are plenty of people out and about. We ate at the YardHouse, just a couple of blocks away. Definitely go there. Great Happy Hour, Great Food and Beers/Wines. The hotel is a one minute walk to the HOB. Really easy and fun. I would rather pay $24.00 to valet park, than drive around a busy city looking for parking. We didn't use our car the entire time. Everything is within walking distance. I would definitely stay again and would reccommend to other travelers if you plan on being out and about in the city. If you want to hang out at a hotel with a pool, bar and other amenities, you might want to chose a different experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay Downtown”
Reviews.Author: So_Few_Vacation_Days
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one week and had a great time. The staff was very friendly and helpful and gladly accomodated our early check in request. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable; the hotel in a great location. As per the previous comments about vagrants in the area, the descriptions are accurate. However, there are no more homeless folks than in any other large city. I found the breakfast buffet ($13) a good value as it includes a drink, fresh fruit, pastries, waffles and an omelette bar. Additionally there are many very nice places to eat within a 5-10 minute walk into the gaslamp. We enjoyed the central location 5 mins from Padre's, Balboa Park, and airport. 15 mins from Mission and Pacific Beaches, 20-30 mins to La Jolla and Del Mar

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to praise”
Reviews.Author: vztak
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disapointed, especially considering all positive reviews here. Really, I don't understand why people are giving this hotel such high reviews. As Marriott gold member, I've stayed in many Marriotts and Courtyards, and this was probably one of the worst experiences. The location is ok in terms of its proximity to restaurants, but the immediate area is somewhat seedy and overrun with homeless people. The rooms are very dated in in bad need of renovations.The first room we stayed in was extremely poorly cleaned. There was a magazine with remnants of some food (yuck!). The front desk people were very nice and after apologizing profusely moved us to another room. It was cleaner, but still in need of renovation. As for the food, we only had breakfast, but it was BAD. We requested a late checkout and were given until 1 pm. At 12 housekeeping knocked asking us when we were leaving. 30 minutes later someone else knocked asking us the same thing. Mind you, all this time we had "DO NOT DISTURB" sign on our door, which was simply ignored. Overall, with the exception of the front desk staff, the service and accommodations were bad.

Reviews.Title: “OK. But nothing to write home about.”
Reviews.Author: sgl11453
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed. I read all the great reviews here and that's why I chose it. It was OK, but I thought the downside's outweighed the positives. The location is good in the sense that you can walk to a lot of restaurants for dinner and even a movie theatre. It's one block from a trolly stop and a short taxi ride to many attractions. The neighborhood is on the edge. Homeless people on the street and a shop that sold undergarmets for the adventuresome. Doesn't bother me much, but I was with my daugher, so I don't recommend staying here with kids. The room didn't have a mini bar and the some of the moulding in the bathroom was rusty. Also terrible bed. I woke I with a back ache each morning. The food was REALLY bad. Even the breakfast... which is usually hard to screw up. The staff was very nice. My key card didn't work when I arrived and someone from engineering came up and fixed it right away. I paid $149 a night. Front desk people were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with good value”
Reviews.Author: minnaert
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great old bank building right on the edge of the main strip of the gaslamp district and a redeveloping part of town. When compared to those places nearby of similar quality, our interior room at $195 a night was a very good value. We ate breakfast one morning at the hotel. There was not continental breakfast, but the choices and quality were fine. We walked to an evening Padres game, which was about 10 minutes away. The walk is right through the gaslamp district, so this is a great location, you can stop for dinner on the way to the park, and drinks on the way home. The room was appointed well. everything was new. the linens and towels were of great quality. The rooms are different from most hotel rooms since they were previously offices. The room was spacious for a standard room with a queen bed. A big drawback is parking. $24 a day is pretty steep, but there is little choice, and the other locations area similar price. we didn't move our car once we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “We loved everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: Jammin66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week while in San Diego, and we absolutely loved everything about it. Every staff member was very friendly and accommodating (one even gave us a tour of the place, which was fascinating, since it is a renovated old bank building), our room was very clean, the beds were comfortable, and the shower had the best water pressure I've ever found. The location was perfect for us to be able to walk to everything we wanted. We very much enjoyed our week in San Diego, and this hotel greatly contributed to that. We couldn't have been more thrilled with our selection and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasonArizonaSurprise
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. The only reason the hotel does not get an excellent rating is due to the parking situation at the hotel. The parking is valet only and very expensive. The valet is located next to a busy intersection and can it can be difficult to find a spot to park your vechile so you can check into the hotel. The staff at the hotel however, was very friendly and the rooms were very clean. The hotel also was in a very good location.
